Octavio debe surtir su negocio cada determinado tiempo pero a veces sus ingresos no le alcanzan para comprar la mercancía necesaria y así obtener mejores ganancias. Es por esto que solicita el crédito porque es conciente que comprando los insumos al por mayor podrá tener mayores beneficios y un incremento en las ventas.
texts.en:
Octavio M. has worked as an itinerant salesman for 18 years.  He started in this line of work on the streets of the city of Medellín.  Approximately ten years ago he decided to specialize in selling and repairing umbrellas.

He usually works Mondays through Saturdays from 6:30 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  Because he works independently he can choose his schedule according to what works best for him.

Octavio has five children, and his greatest dream is to generate more income.  This would allow him to make his family financially comfortable and improve their quality of live.

Octavio needs to stock his business every so often.  Sometimes his income is not enough to buy the needed merchandise to get improved income.  That is why he is requesting the loan.  He knows that by purchasing the supplies wholesales he will be able to have greater benefits and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Carlos Gonzalo

texts.es: El Joven Carlos se dedica al servicio de transporte con vehículo de su propiedad, y cuando no trabaja con su taxi, se dedica a trabajar como mecánico, tiene una experiencia de dos años en dicha actividad después que regreso de España, se compro su auto, vive en domicilio de su propiedad junto a  su hermana y cuñado, solicita el monto para la refacción de su vehículo ya que este sufrió un accidente y tiene que realizar la refacción de su vehículo para poder retomar la actividad de transporte, es un joven trabajador con ganas de superación y se encuentra a gradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carlos provides public transportation services with his own vehicle, and when he is not working with his taxi, he works as a mechanic. He has two years' experience in the business. When he arrived back from Spain he purchased a car. He lives in a house that he owns together with his sister and his brother-in-law. He requests a loan to carry out maintenance repairs to his car as it suffered an accident and he need to repair it before he can start providing transport services again. He is a young worker who is eager to improve. He is thankful to the organization for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and automotive spare parts.

loans.name: Peter Njuguna

texts.en:
Peter, aged 32, is married to Josephine, and they are blessed with two children, 12 and 18 years old.

He practices farming. He grows crops and also keeps livestock, which he has been doing for the last 20 years. The business earns him a monthly income of KES 36,650.

This is his third loan from KADET Ltd. He has successfully managed to repay the previous loans.

He intends to use the loan funds to purchase a dairy cow to start producing milk for sale. 

Peter hopes to educate his children and provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro de 33 años de edad es un padre de familia que vive con su esposo y  sus 3 hijos, en casa en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos,   en el distrito de Olmos, a una hora de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

Alejandro se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas ) y caprino (cabras) desde hace 6 años, su corral donde se encuentran sus animales está en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  vez  que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo los ofrece en el mercado de Lambayeque.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por sus animales podrá atender las necesidades diarias de su hogar y familia.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado y su respectivo alimento,  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de sus animales y poderlos ofertar a un mejor precio.   Alejandro es conocida en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y como todo padre quiere sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
Alejandro de 33 años de edad es un padre de familia que vive con su esposo y  sus 3 hijos, en casa en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos,   en el distrito de Olmos, a una hora de distancia del departamento de Lambayeque.  Se caracteriza por ser una zona de mucha actividad agricola y ganadera.

Alejandro se dedica  a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (ovejas ) y caprino (cabras) desde hace 6 años, su corral donde se encuentran sus animales está en la parte posterior de su casa, los cría con alimentos balanceados como con pastos naturales  y una  vez  que tengan el peso y el tamaño óptimo los ofrece en el mercado de Lambayeque.  Con el dinero que va adquirir por sus animales podrá atender las necesidades diarias de su hogar y familia.

A solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado y su respectivo alimento,  asegurando un buen crecimiento y engorde de sus animales y poderlos ofertar a un mejor precio.   Alejandro es conocida en la zona por ser una persona trabajadora, responsable y como todo padre quiere sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Comprar más animales y su respectivo alimento

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres de Fe lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras  una de ellas es la señora Juana de 32 años quien inicio vendiendo ropa y con las ganancias puso su pulpería hace aproximadamente dos años. Ella es soltera tiene tres hijos unos gemelos de 8 años y uno de 14 quienes le ayudan a ver el negocio en los tiempos libres
Las otras integrantes son María Auxiliadora quien desde hace 10 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y Damaris Ignacia de 39 años hace 12 años inicio haciendo ropa de cama y cinco años después instalo una minipulperia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Fe (Women of Faith) group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women. One of them is Juana (32 years old) who began selling clothing and started her grocery store with her earnings about two years ago. She is single and has three children, eight-year-old twins and a fourteen-year-old, who help her with the business in their free time.

The other members are María Auxiliadora, who has sold clothing for 10 years, and Damaris Ignacia (39 years old), who began selling bedding 12 years ago and started a small grocery store five years later.

loans.use: to buy clothing (pants, shirts, etc.) and basic grains.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 48 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
Perla has borrowed and paid back 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Zizamelni Group

texts.en:
Ntombi is 60 years old and married with 4 children between the ages of 18 and 39. She also takes care of 3 relatives who live with her. She has been in business for 3 years, operating a tuck shop (small retail food store) that sells bread, sugar, candles, soup, and other items to her neighbors. She also receives money through a child support grant administered by the South African government.

Ntombi says that one of her children attends school, and this loan will help her pay for her child's education. In 5 years, Ntombi would like her business to become a tea room and store. She is excited to appear on the internet and would like to thank WDB and Kiva for extending support through this loan. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy bread, sugar, candles, and other things for resale.

loans.name: Windel

texts.en: Windel is a 33-year-old woman, married and living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has four school-aged children with her. She has been growing corn for 10 years as her means of survival. She generates a total of PHP 3,000 a month. Windel has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase corn fertilizers and pay for planting costs. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Windel hopes to own a motorcycle in the future to easily transmit the goods to buyers to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase corn fertlizer and pay for planting costs

loans.name: Aida Janneth

texts.es:
Aida Janneth tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera vive con los padres, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C 	PATRON SAN JUAN , se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad San Juan, sector Llullundondo, parroquia Guanujo, a una distancia de 25 minutos  perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.

Aida Janneth se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales siembra en los terrenos de los padres. Compra y vende sus productos en la ciudad de Guaranda

Solicita el crédito para, compra de abonos, semillas y para comprar animales e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y llegar a tener algo propio. Su sueño es ampliar su producción, comprar una terreno seguir estudiando. 

Le gustan las festividades del carnaval y del patrón San Juan, realizar actividades como salir a pasear.
texts.en:
Aida Janneth, 19, is single and lives with her parents in Guaranda, a canton in Bolivar province.

The PATRON SAN JUAN community bank is in San Juan, a rural community in Guaranda.  The bank's members make their living from farming and raising livestock.  

Aida Janneth grows crops on land owned by her parents and raises livestock for sale.  She buys and sells what she needs in the city of Guaranda.  She is applying for a loan to buy compost, seeds and animals so that she can expand her business.

The loan will meet her immediate requirements and leave her something extra, as well.  She wants to increase her production, buy land of her own and continue studying.

She likes the celebrations for Patron San Juan and everyday pleasures like seeing her friends.

loans.use: to buy animals and supplies for farming and livestock business.

loans.name: Aslon

texts.ru: Аслон проживает в районе Яван. Ему 70 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Двое его сыновей находятся на заработках заграницей. Сам Аслон имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии он проработал 27 лет. На сегодняшний день Аслон занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже девять лет. Кредит берет для посева бахчевых культур. То есть для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Aslon lives in Yavan. He is 70 years old, married, and has seven children. His two sons are earning money abroad. Aslon has a higher education in pedagogy.  He worked in his profession for 27 years. Now, Aslon farms. He rents the land where he grows vegetables. He has been doing this work for nine years. He is taking out a loan to plant melons, primarily to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to plant melons

loans.name: Neav

texts.en:
Neav, 48 years old, is a farmer with her husband; their income is $8 per day. She has seven children; three are studying, and the other four are working with $11 per day for all. Every month, she has to spend $66 on food, $5 on electricity, $10 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy two cows for doing farming. This couple never think of changing their career as farmers. They even plan to do more farming if they have the ability to buy more rice field to cultivate.

loans.use: To buy two cows for doing farming.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 47 years old and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with three school-aged children.
 
Amalia owns and operates a sari-sari store in their place selling most of the basic commodities - groceries, school and office supplies, a few hardware products and accessories like hair clips, hair pins, headbands, etc. She has run the store for over 25 years. Her spouse works as a motorcycle driver from which a funding for store inventory is rarely taken. She receives approximately net income PHP 6,573 a month from from her general store and from her husband business. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 from GDMPC to invest in expanding her store inventory.

Amalia has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. The previous loans were paid in full and this becomes her third cycle of borrowings in the cooperative. In the future, Amalia hopes to sustain her business subsistence and expand her business offerings. She expects to take another loan in the future.

loans.use: To invest in expanding store inventory.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old, a married woman with five children, two of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling beer in Dar es Salam branch in Yei, south Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Mary has requested this loan through BRAC, south Sudan, to be able to purchase or order for more beer to sell. The extra income from this loan will be used for building a house for the children in the future.

loans.use: to be able to purchase more beer to sell.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rovelyn works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from an electronic reloading and sari-sari (variety) store. Rovelyn is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rovelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 59 years old and married with five children. She lives in Migcawanay, Tangub City. To earn a living, Angelita has a stall in the public market of her town, where she displays her vegetables products like eggplant, amplaya, cabbage and others. Angelita had been in this business for about 18 years. Every month, she earns PHP 3,500 doing this type of activity. Angelita is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan to purchase additional vegetables for sale.

Angelita joined GDMPC in the year 2008 and she is now in the second cycle of the loan. Angelita's plan is that in the future she can save from her returns for the renovation of her house for comfortable living.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Hassan from Aberdeen, in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. He is married with an 11-year-old son. His child is currently attending school. 

Hassan runs a general merchandise store in Aberdeen.  He sells drinks, iron rods, toiletries, paint, biscuits, and provisions. He has been running this business for four years.  He also earns income from his taxi business. He says that the main challenge to his business is that he needs electricity to cool his water and drinks.

Hassan has requested a loan in order to buy more drinks, cement, and iron rods. The extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to open branches of the same business. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, cement, iron rods, and mosquito spray to sell at his store.

loans.name: Simma Group

texts.fr:
Mme Dadissa est la représentante du groupe SIMMA. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. Tous les 2 vont à l’école et elle a 2 personnes à sa charge.

Elle vend des chaussures et habits de puis 11ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes.

Mme veut s’acheter 30paires de chaussures, complets de pagnes et 05 complets d’habits pour enfants.

Elle veut économiser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une boutique de pagnes et chaussures.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dadissa is the representative of the Simma Group. She is married and the mother of two children who attend school. The eldest is 20 years old, and the youngest is 13. She also looks after two others dependents. 

She has been selling shoes and clothing for 11 years. She buys her merchandise at the Sector 10 market, in the city. Her customers are women. 

Mrs. Dadissa would like to purchase 30 pairs of shoes, some pagnes, and five sets of children’s outfits. She wants to save her profits in order to expand her business. Her goal is to open a shop to sell pagnes and footwear.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pairs of shoes, pagnes, and children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Fatmata. She is married to a trader and has four children, aged 25, 18,15 and 10 years respectively; all are school-going children. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her because she is a foster child.   

In 1991, Fatmata established her cola-nuts, palm oil, pepper and groundnut business. She began her business because she was unprivileged to attend school and her father forced her into early marriage at the age of 15 years to a businessman. They did business together for some years but later her husband gave her some money to establish her own business, which has grown over the years from a stall to a shop.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 1,066,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.   

Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase the following items: Cola-nuts - 10 bags @ Le400,00; and palm oil - 8 rubbers @ Le90,000. The balance will be used to pay laborers.  

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 160,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to build another house and have her own store. She also plans to provide a quality education for her children.  

She feels good in taking this loan as it will help her to earn more income. Her major challenge is that sometimes she can buy some items with a high cost from her suppliers but when she goes to sell them, there will be a fall in prices. Competition is high, but she overcomes her competitors by selling at a reduced cost. She serves 10 customers each day.   

Her business is popular because she is honest and sells at a reduce price. Her suppliers are located in Bo Town and Sanda. She transports her supplies by public vehicle, and she buys three times per month. She adds her profit to the business. She is planning to expand her business and this will be accomplished by acquiring loans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase the following items: cola-nuts - 10 bags @ Le400,00; and palm oil - 8 rubbers @ Le90,000.

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en: Sugran (right) is 49, married, and lives with her family including five children. Her two older children work while the other three are getting their education in school. Sugran’s days are focused on managing her artificial jewelry business. She sells jewelry to different shops and to her community members who she serves with good products. She has been operating her business for over 10 years.  Her husband’s economic mainstay is selling fruit. He buys fruit from the fruit markets in bulk by visiting early in the morning and then sells to his customers. He is a very hard worker. He always sells fresh quality fruits to the customers and never compromises on quality. For his sincere thought and quality fruit, he makes good sales and earns better profits. With this loan, Sugran will buy artificial jewelry such as necklaces, ear-rings, and bangles in bulk to be able to fulfill customers' demands on time and so generate more revenue. She is expecting to make good saving from her business after the loan investment.

loans.use: To buy artificial jewelry for re-selling

loans.name: Bioleta

texts.es:
Bioleta de 27 años de edad, convive con Henry el padre de sus 5 hijos de 8, 6, 4 y 2 años; y un pequeño bebé de 3 meses de nacido. Esta numerosa pero feliz familia vive en una casa propia en la localidad de Centro Pumpuriani, en la provincia de Chanchamayo. Bioleta creció en el campo, ayudando a sus padres en el cultivo de diversos productos. Ahora que ya cuenta con su propia familia también se dedica a la agricultura. Tiene sembrado media parcela de yucas, media de maíz y un lote entero de café y plátanos. 
“La producción de plátanos en esta zona es buena, la tierra negra hace que crezcan sanos. Los plátanos se venden por arrobas de 15 soles”, comenta afirmando la rentabilidad de sus cosechas.
Por su parte, cuenta con otros terrenos en otras localidades, donde siembra café, que estará listo para la cosecha en el mes de marzo, de cuyas ventas obtendrá mayores ganancias.
Para este arduo trabajo recurre al contrato de personal para el cultivo y cosechas.
Bioleta tiene muchos planes. Sus hijos aún son pequeños por eso siente que tiene mucho que hacer, pero ya dio los primeros pasos, ahora le queda seguir sin descanso. Su retribución será ver a su familia feliz y realizada. Este sería su primer préstamo de MFP, que obtendría gracias a su ayuda. A la vez se siente contenta de iniciar con su banco comunal “Las Thinanis de Pumpuriani”. Bioleta invertirá el dinero en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos para sus cultivos de café y maíz.
texts.en:
Bioleta, 27, lives with Henry, the father of her 5 children, who are 8,6,4 and 2 years old and a small baby, 3 months old. This large and happy family lives in its own home in the community of Centro Pumpuriani in the province of Chanchamayo.

Bioleta was raised in the country, helping her parents cultivate different products. Now that she has her own family, she continues to be a farmer. She has half a parcel planted in yucca, half in corn and an entire plot with coffee and bananas. “Banana production is good in this area, the black earth assures healthy growth. Twenty five pounds of bananas sell for 15 soles,” she comments, affirming the profitability of her crops.

She also has other land in other settlements, where she plants coffee, which will be ready for harvest in March, and its sale will bring in large profits. She resorts to contract labor to do the hard work of cultivation and harvesting. 

Bioleta has many plans. Her children are still small and thus she feels she has much to do, but she has already taken the first steps and now she has to continue working tirelessly. Her reward will be to see her family happy and empowered. This will be her first loan with MFP, which she will obtain thanks to your help. She is also pleased to start with her communal bank, “Las Thinanis de Pumpuriani.”  Bioleta will invest the money in the purchase of sacks of organic fertilizer for her fields of coffee and corn.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Dado

texts.fr:
Dado est une femme âgée de 25 ans. Elle est célibataire et a 01 enfant.
Dado travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2006. Elle vend de la liqueur. Elle achète les produits à Lomé.  Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Dado a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des liqueurs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Dado voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de subvenir à ses besoins et de son enfant.
texts.en: Dado is a 25 year old woman. She is single with one child.  Dado has worked as a retailer since 2006. She sells liquor. She buys the products in Lome. She works alone. Right now, she does not have any problems.  Dado is asking for her first loan from WAGES in order to buy liquor.  She wants to reinvest in her business. In the coming years, Dado would like to open a store. She says that with the profits, she plans support herself and her child.

loans.use: to buy liquor.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana María , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , desde hace muchos años de dedica a fabricar pan artesanal , ella con el primer crédito logro mejorar parte de la infraestructura del negocio y dejo una parte para invertirlo en hacer leche agria y tortilla para aprovechar la mañana y obtener un ingreso adicional ya que el pan lo hacen por las tardes para venderlo calientito y fresco , esto a provocado que las ventas se incrementen pero el mayor obstáculo es no tener suficiente recursos económicos para brindarle una mejor demanda a sus clientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y sus sueños es poder comprar algún día un horno industrial para ya no tener que quemarse tanto con la leña del horno artesanal.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. For many years she has made a living making artisanal bread. 

With her first loan she was able to improve her business' infrastructure. She left part of it aside to invest in making leche agria [a fermented milk product served for breakfast] and tortillas to take advantage of the morning hours and make an additional income since she makes her bread in the afternoons in order to sell it hot and fresh. This has helped to increase her income however, the biggest obstacle is not having enough financial resources to increase demand from her customers. 

Her plan for her family is to improve their living conditions and her dream is to one day be able to buy an industrial oven so that she doesn't end up burning so much bread as she does in the artisanal oven.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a retail shop that has been in open for ten years.  Fredrick obtained a small amount of money from his uncle, $12 at the time, to start this business.  The shop now has a substantial amount of stock.

Fredrick is applying for a 40,000 KES loan to purchase more electronics, such as watches.  His main business challenges are finding customers and inflation.  In spite of these issues, Fredrick would like to own an electronics supply shop in the future.  He also plans to save the extra income obtained from this loan and finally purchase a parcel of land.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell at his retail shop.

loans.name: Samaher

texts.en:
Samaher is 34 years old and she lives in Gaza with her husband and four children, three of whom attend school. Samaher sells home products in her shop and this job is the only financial income for her family. She earns around 800 USD monthly. Samaher asked Ryada for this loan to buy shelves and install glass doors. She hopes that this loan will help support the needs of her family, and allow her to reinvest in her business.

Samaher is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy shelves and install glass doors.

loans.name: Darya's Group

texts.en: Darya, a farmer living in Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, is 22 years old. She is a young mother of two young children. She is growing rice as her main source of income and she works as a labor for others to supplement income. She has involved her business for 4 years and she can save from her daily income about 5 USD per day. The insect has destroyed her crop, so she could not sell it in higher price. For Darya, this is her first loan with VisionFund and she is a group leader of two members to get this new loan. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy more fertilizer to improve on her rice farm to produce good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income from her business, so she can upgrade her lifestyle and keeps her children to school on time.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to support on her rice farming to get good yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Piedad Portillo

texts.en:
I am a baker who can do all kids of baking to meet the needs of my customers. Honduras has many delicious baked goods to try such as Rosquillas (corn and cheese donuts), tustacas (corn cookies with raw cane sugar), vanilla cookes and semitas (another cookie).

However, my specialty which I am well-known for, is cakes and sweets. My most popular product is birthday cakes, which are ordered by my clients a few days before the birthday party.

loans.use: Money to increase inventory and happiness.

loans.name: Díaz Moctezuma

texts.en:
J. lives in Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. She is divorced which left her to support her three children. At that time in the 70's she started a small business, a restaurant, but she was forced to stop to care for her children. Four years ago she decided to reopen her business, remodeling the interior. Today her business is generating a good income and therefore she wants it to continue to grow.

She needs a loan for $USD475 to purchase supplies which she uses to prepare her food. She only needs your help, without it she cannot develop her business. We look forward to your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora J. vive en la localidad de Monterrey Nuevo León. Ella es divorciada, por lo que se quedó al frente de la manutención de sus tres hijos, fue entonces que en los años 70 ella inició un pequeño negocio, un restaurant, pero interrumpió su actividad para atender a sus hijos. Sin embargo hace cuatro años decidió volver a abrir su negocio, remodelando las instalaciones de la anterior. Hasta ahora ésta actividad le ha generado buenos ingresos, por lo que desea continuar creciendo.

Ella necesita de 475 DLLs para comprar mercancía, misma que utiliza como insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos. Sólo basta con que la apoyes, pues sin tu ayuda no podrá desarrollar su negocio. Esperamos tu generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Issaka

texts.en:
Married and the mother of four children, Mrs. Issaka has been of selling cloth for women's clothing for four years. According to her, her business will finally allow her to provide for the primary needs of her family, and she will not have to carry goods on her head and move around to sell her products, like most of her solidarity group members are doing. Because of a huge demand, she believes that she will be able to establish something more permanent and stable to avoid her up and down tours, which involve a lot of risks.

Mrs. Issaka is part of a HELP Africa solidarity group of four women. The solidarity group is called, “Essohana” which has collectively applied for a loan of $800. Each member of the group will receive a part of this loan and will be responsible for helping their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

loans.use: Increase business activities

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet A. is a dedicated community health worker (CHW).  She lives in Bware Migori, Kenya, with her husband and four school-going children. She was trained by KMET in home-based HIV/AIDS care. Through her own initiative and hard work, she opened a community pharmacy at Achuth market in Bware, the only one serving the surrounding community. Linet has managed to expand her business and build a successful community pharmacy. As there is no chemist in her area, people come from quite a distance to buy drugs from her pharmacy. She moved her business to this more prominent and spacious location (pictured) four years ago in order to meet the growing demand. To boost her profits, Linet requires an additional US $600 to increase her stock of drugs, which are in high demand.

loans.use: Add stock of drugs

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu B. is thirty-six years old and started his business three years ago.  Although he has a place in the main market in Kabala, Sierra Leone, he often travels to the village during the village market days.  Amadu is married with a child and his plan is to provide the best education for his child.  He is requesting a loan of $250 to increase his stock and reduce his visits to Freetown to buy more goods.

loans.use: to Increase inventory for village market days

loans.name: Hezi

texts.en: Mr. Hazi Hemzeyiv is a low income person which makes him vulnerable. He is 25 years old and lives in Sumgayit city in the north-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic. He is married and has two children. He is a driver of public transportation. He began his business five years ago and it has allowed him to support his family. In 2002 Hezi bought a mini bus. This car was often demanding repair. His minibus was old and he planned to sell it and to buy a new one. He eventually bought a new vehicle to use for his public transportation service. This bus is very comfortable and his passengers are very satisfied, but there not any bus stations near his house. He wants he borrow $600 to build a garage near his house. He hopes eventually to expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family. He will repay this loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To build a garage near his house.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is 44 years old. She has been in the clothing business for over 6 years. She is married and has two children. Her business located in the Istaravshan clothing market, Khujand, Tadjikistan. She is renting a small stand and has good turnover of her goods. She buys her goods from the wholesale market here for resale at her stand. She generally sells tights and socks. For the coming winter she wants to purchase 50 pairs of warm tights and  50 pairs of leg-warmers, as that kind of goods will be in high demand.

loans.use: expand her inventory of clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Grimanesa

texts.es:
Grimanesa is a member of the Santa Ana Communal Bank and lives in the San Martin region in the province and district of Moyabamba. Her business is situated in the local supply market. She sells cecina (a smoked cured meat), chorizo sausage and chicharrón (pork rind) and its derivatives. For 30 years now, thanks to the great flavoring, hygiene and customer service she offers, she counts with loyal clients not only from that zone, but also from other parts of the region.

With the loan of S/. 1,500.00, which she will repay in 6 months, she will buy the necessary ingredients for the preparation of her products like pork, which is her essential prime material, and the necessary condiments for the preparation of her smoked meats and sausages. She also sells raw red meat.

Grimanesa is 61 years old and the mother of 7 children, all independent now. The business she runs has turned her into an independent, perseverant, decisive and secure woman. She dreams of starting a business with sales associates of red meats and its derivatives.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Grimanesa es socia del Banco Comunal “ Santa Ana”, vive en la región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Moyabamba. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de abastos de la localidad. Se dedica a la venta de cecina, chorizo, chicharrón y sus derivados y desde hace 30 años , gracias a la buena sazón, higiene y buen servicio que presta, cuenta con clientes fieles no sólo de la zona, también de otras partes del departamento.

Con el préstamo de S/.1,500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos como los cerdos (chanchos), que es la materia prima esencial y los condimentos necesarios para la elaboración de las carnes ahumadas y los embutidos, también comercializa carne roja cruda.

La señora Grimanesa tiene 61 años, es madre de 7 hijos todos ellos independiente. El negocio que desarrolla la ha convertido en una mujer independiente, perseverante, decidida y segura, sueña con formar una empresa de negociantes asociados de venta de carnes rojas y derivados.

loans.use: Purchase necessary ingredients for the preparation of her smoked meats and sausages.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila S. G. has a business manufacturing and selling brooms in the city of Juanjui, San Martin.  She runs the business with her husband and children.  She started the business in 2001 and now has clients all over the province.  They sell the brooms to individuals, general store, and in larger markets.  Although they had many challenges to overcome due to lack of experience and connections, Leila´s business now makes a sustainable profit.

Leila is 41 years old, married, and has 6 children.  She started the business to help her family gain independence from a life of working out in the fields.  Family is the driving force in her life, nothing would make her happier than to see all of her children attend a university or technical school.

Leila is a member of the community bank Micaela Bastidas and is requesting a loan of $350 to repay over the next four months.  With the loan Micaela will buy all of the materials necessary to manufacture the brooms.  The extra capital will help them meet increased demand.

loans.use: To buy materials to manufacture brooms

loans.name: Livia

texts.en: Livia is a seventy-eight year old widow who lives in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal. To make a living, Livia prepares and sells fried vegetables with chicken or pork meat. This activity is her principal source of income. Occasionally she receives money from her five grownup children, whom all have their own families now. With her loan (the second one she will take from FSMA), the entrepreneur will purchase raw materials to keep producing for her customers and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Livia would like to purchase raw materials to produce fried food to sell in her community.

loans.name: Luz 2 Group

texts.es:
Clementina has a business located inside a preparatory school where she sells typical regional food (empanadas, tamales, tacos, tortas, etc.) and snack foods (pork rinds, popcorn, corn with mayonnaise, etc.), which the students love. With a loan, she will invest in the purchase of cookies, soft drinks and other snack foods so that her customers can buy what they are looking for. This is how she works to survive and to be independent, as her children are now adults and have their own lives. She is 63 years old and has 8 children. She belongs to the Solidarity Group called Luz 2, along with Corona de Jesus, Silvia del Rayo and Mercedes del Refugio, who sell clothing; Alma Janet (shoes sales by order), Violeta de Jesus and Maricela, who sell perfumes and cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

DOÑA CLEMENTINA TIENE INSTALADO SU NEGOCIO EN UNA ESCUELA PREPARATORIA EN DONDE VENDE COMIDA TRADICIONAL DE LA REGION (EMPANADAS, TAMALES, TACOS, TORTAS, ETC) Y GOLOSINAS (CHICHARRONES, PALOMITAS, ELOTES CON MAYONESA, ETC) QUE LES FASCINAN A LOS ALUMNOS DE LA ESCUELA, CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE GALLETAS, REFRESCOS, GOLOSINAS PARA QUE SUS CLIENTES ENCUENTREN LO QUE BUSCAN. DE ESTA FORMA TRABAJA PARA SOBREVIVIR Y SER INDEPENDIENTE YA QUE SUS HIJOS ESTAN GRANDES Y TIENEN SU VIDA PROPIA. ELLA TIENE 63 AÑOS, TUVO OCHO HIJOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO LUZ 2 JUNTO CON DOÑA CORONA DE JESUS, SILVIA DEL RAYO, MERCEDES DEL REFUGIO QUE SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE ROPA, ALMA JANET (VENTA DE ZAPATOS A PEDIDO), VIOLETA DE JESUS Y MARICELA QUE VENDEN PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS.

loans.use: Purchase food products to sell.

loans.name: Mulija

texts.en:
Mulija was born in 1987 and she is married. Her husband is employed and he re-sells plastics earning a monthly income of 1000.00KM. In the period when her husband is not employed, they work at the market and sell clothes. They have additional income in the form of a pension of 288.00KM. The S. family have three children, ages 2, 3 and 5.

Mulija wants to use this loan in the amount of 1200.00KM to invest in the existing clothes business.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes for reselling.

loans.name: Dioulayel 2 Group

texts.fr:
After our first loan which we were able to completely reimburse in a timely manner, we would like to request another loan from Kiva to continue to work as we began to do a year ago. Our work consists in engaging in petty trading to sustain our families, and thanks to the loan that we received from SEM, we have even been able to put aside some savings after having made our repayments.You are the only lenders who have helped us to work normally, without constraints. This is the reason why we would like to renew the loan you had granted us.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Suite au premier prêt que nous sommes parvenues à rembourser intégralement et dans les delais, nous sommes venues solliciter un autre prêt auprès de Kiva pour continuer à travailler comme nous l'avions commencé, il y a un an. Notre travail consiste à faire du petit commerce pour soutenir nos familles et grâce au prêt que nous avions reçu de SEM, nous arrivons même à faire des économies après avoir rembourser. Vous êtes les seuls bailleurs qui nous ont aidé à travailler normalement sans contrainte. c'est pour cela que nous souhaitons renouveler le prêt que vous nous aviez accordé.

loans.use:
purchase of household necessities and foodstuffs

achat de produits domestiques et alimentaires.

loans.name: Chhea

texts.en: Chhea Y., 54, is a widowed farmer who lives with her only daughter. Living in the Kampong Cham province, she typically makes US$1 every day and is aided by her daughter who works in a garment factory. The Kampong Cham area has not seen favorable weather conditions for farming this past year. Along with increased inflation, it has been a difficult year economically in much of Cambodia. As a farmer, Chhea Y. is taking a lot of the brunt of the economic downturn. That is why she has approached CREDIT with a request for a loan. Chhea Y. is asking for a loan of US$300 to purchase of fertilizer, a purchase that she sees as a good opportunity to increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new fashionable clothing to add to her stock.

loans.name: Rajan's Group

texts.en:
Rajan baji is the wife of M. A. and lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Rajan baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She invested her share in her husband's business. Her husband made a cycle stand where people come to stand their cycles and he gives a token to them and charges a fee.

Presently her husband is doing nothing; because of some circumstances he failed to continue the business. Now Rajan baji is applying for a loan to start a grocery shop for her husband and to buy groceries she requires a loan.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy food ingredients (cooking oil, rice, wheat) for her food business. Hafizan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Khalida baji and Saima baji each want a loan to buy shoes for their shoe-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Phung Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Phung T. T., 25 years old, joined TYM  2 years ago. Before, her family mainly grew rice and sold mats. Then they realized that junk selling would be more profitable, so they switched to this business. After 8 years dealing with this business, they are very experienced now and junk selling has become their main source of income. With VND 150,000 earned from this job, her family's living conditions have been improved. Now she wants to borrow VND 9 million to further invest in this business.

loans.use: to expand their junk sales

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Mrs. Bimala T. M. lives in Balkhu, Kathmandu. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. Mrs. Bimala lives in a single family with her husband and one son. Her husband's name is Mr. Laxmi T. M., and her son is studying in grade two.

Mrs. Bimala T. is a farmer in the town of Bhalkhu. She prefers to grow seasonal vegetables on her land, and now she is growing green vegetables. She sells her vegetables at the local market in the morning and evening.

Mrs. Bimala T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Benkadi (Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres de Benkadi sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne de 37 ans et 3 enfants et vivant dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Dougoukoro de la ville de Yanfolila (une des préfectures de la troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles sont unies par les liens de voisinage et d’amitié. Ce groupe s’est spécialisée dans le secteur de la vente des tissus wax(tissus très prisés en Afrique) et des céréales.
Elles sont parténaires avec l’institution SoroYiriwaso depuis maintenat 2 ans et sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire(prêt de groupe).Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Ce prêt leur permettra d’acheter,  40 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako auprès des grossistes du domaine et 1000 kg de céréales auprès de forains venant des villages environnants.
Ces pagnes  ainsi achetés sont découpés en  “trois pagnes”et vendus au comptant et en  détail dans les différents quartiers de Yanfolila et au marché. Ce commerce permet de générer 1250 FCFA de bénéfice par pièce vendue.Quant aux  vendeuses de céréales elles revendent au comptant en  détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée surtout de femmes.
Les membres de Benkadi espèrent réaliser chacune dans sa spécialité un bénéfice de 50.000 FCFA par mois qu’elles comptent utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt et aider les conjoints à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille. Les femmes  de ce groupe ambitionnent ouvrir des boutiques et des magasins de vente de céréales afin d’élargir la taille de la clientèle.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi are all married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have 3 children. They live in extended traditional families in the Dougoukoro neighborhood in the city of Yanfolila (one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are linked by bonds of neighborhood and friendship. This groups specializes in selling Wax pagne (a highly prized cloth in Africa) and cereals. They've been partnering with the Soro Yiriwaso institution for two years now and are seeking their fourth solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans have been repaid without problems. This loan will enable them to buy 40 pieces of Wax pagne from wholesalers in Bamako, as well as 100 kg of cereals from itinerant merchants coming from the surrounding villages. The pagnes are then cut into "trois pagnes" ("three pagnes", i.e. the amount of fabric needed to make some woman outfits) and retailed for cash in the market and in the various neighborhoods in Yanfolila. The business results in a profit of XOF 1250 (ca US$ 2.40) per piece. The cereals are retailed to a mostly female clientele, for cash and on credit. The members of the Benkadi group hope to make, each in their speciality, a monthly profit of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 100) that thy intend to use to repay the loan and help their husbands in providing for the family. The women of this group have the ambition to open cereals shops to broaden their clientele.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Wax pagnes (highly prized cloth) and cereals

loans.name: Maria Leonor

texts.es: Leonor B., tiene una venta de tortillas, ella también vende cómales para caber tortillas, y los vende en diferentes lugares, también se dedica a la venta ropa típica  de mujer.  En la venta de tortillas ya tiene 20 años, antes era de su mama quien tenia ese negocio y se lo dejo a ella.  En la venta de cómales tiene 10 años.  Leonor se siente satisfecha porque en el transcurso de su negocio Dios la ha Bendecido grandemente, y ha podido ir mejorando las condiciones en las que vive, tiene dos hijos una tiene 22 años que trabaja con ella en la venta de tortillas, y el otro es mas pequeño y esta estudiando.  Con este préstamo ella quiere comprar mas materiales por mayor y  maíz por quintales, ya que le sale mas barato y puede tener de esta forma mejores ganancias, también quiere comprar cómales por docena que los tiene encargados. Leonor sueña con comprar un vehiculo, ya que el que tenía se le descompuso, y pagar los transportes de materiales le sale demasiado caro porque viaja lejos.
texts.en:
Leonor B. works selling tortillas, and she also sells cómales (ceramic dish for cooking tortillas), which she sells in different locations. She also dedicates herself to selling traditional women’s clothing. She has been selling tortillas for twenty years, having learned from her mother who left her the business. She has been selling the cómales for 10 years. Leonor is happy because God has blessed her greatly, and she has been able to continue to improve her standard of living. She has two children, a 22-year old who helps her with the tortilla business, and a younger child who is still in school. With this loan she would like to buy more materials at wholesale and corn in bulk, as this would be more cost-effective and would allow her to increase her profits. She would also like to purchase cómales that she has on order by the dozen. Leonor dreams of buying a vehicle, as the one she had broke down, since buying her supplies is expensive because she must travel far for them.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials for her tortilla-making business, and comales (ceramic dish for cooking tortillas) to sell.

loans.name: Central B1- Nalugo Victor Group

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Victor N. is a banana vendor in Kabalagala market. She sells two types of bananas, namely bogoya and ndizi. Before she started this business, she used to have a restaurant in the same locality from which she accumulated the capital to start this business. She attracts her customers by ensuring good services, attractive display, healthy fruits and a hygienic environment.

Victor is using this loan to purchase bogoya and ndizi to add to her stock. She purchases the fruits from the Masaka suppliers. When she sells bananas worth 400,000 Ugandan shillings (about USD$200), she earns an average of 100,000 shillings profit. Her ambition is to remain in the same business but as a supplier. Being a single mother of four and a guardian to one orphan, she hopes that when she fulfills her ambition, she will be in a position to educate the five children and offer them a decent home and life.

Victor will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase bogoya and ndizi.

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.en:
Marua N., age 41, is married with three children ages 19, 13 and 8. She sells cold drinks. She started this business in 2002 and works daily from 8am until midnight. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 349.

This will be Marua’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first three loans to increase the stock of the drinks she sells, pay school fees as well, and she has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to increase her stock further, pay school fees, and to save the rest.

Marua will share this loan with subgroup C of the Mapatano Group. The subgroup has 4 members, who sell drinks, bites, clothes, and are food vendors. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Marua is second from left.

loans.use: To increase her stock, pay school fees, and save the rest

loans.name: Wal Fatkhou Group

texts.fr: le groupement wal fatkhou est une association regroupant quatre femmes (04) oeuvrant pour l'ameillioration des conditions de vie de la femme.Il est dirigé par la nommée Diame N.  qui vend des tissus de meme que marietou .les deux autres sont dans le commerce de repas et la quincaillerie.Avec les revenus tires de leurs activités elles parcipement aux charges de lurs foyers respectifs mais parviennent à affirmer leur autonomie financiere .Pour renforcer respectivement leur activité elle sollicite un pret au pres de linstitution de microfinance.
texts.en:
The group Wal Fatkhou is an association of four women working to improve living conditions for women. They are directed by the renowned Diame N., who sells cloth, just like Marietou does. Two others do commerce in hardware and in selling meals. With the revenues derived from their businesses, the women help cover the expenses in their respective households but also manage to maintain their financial autonomy. To bolster their respective businesses, they are requesting a loan from the micro-finance institution.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria F., 32, is married with 6 children. She has 2 years of experience in a vegetable garden business. She sells to the village people and the general public 3 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $166 USD).

SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy farming equipment, iron roofing for home improvement, and school uniforms for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a spray gun, rake, water hose, chemicals, vegetable seeds, wheelbarrow, iron roofing and children's school uniforms.

loans.name: Parveen M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan, for the past nine years. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he has a pesticides-selling business. He has been doing this work for the past four years. Parveen baji operates a clothes-sewing business. She does this work to share the financial burden of her husband. She is applying for a loan to buy pesticides to expand her husband’s business.

Parveen baji is the group leader of three another women from her locality. Hajran baji wants a loan to buy pesticides to sell. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy supplies (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food-selling business. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to expand her husband’s business

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata has a snack kiosk in a local high school where she sells lunches as well as snacks, drinks and sweets to teachers and students. Fortunata has had her kiosk for the past year. Prior to running the stand, she raised small animals like guinea pigs and hens at her house. Fortunata is 31-years old and is married with four children. Her oldest child is 11 while the youngest is just 18-months old.

Fortunata starts cooking and preparing food at her home at 7 am each day. She spends three and a half hours in preparation, then leaves for school. Her busiest time of day is 11:30 am, when the students have their lunch recess. Fortunata earns about 30 soles a day in profit, depending on how many competitors are working near the school on a given day.

Fortunata is requesting a loan of 1800 soles to buy fruit, yogurt, and cookies in bulk. She expects this supply to last for about three months. She has pledged to repay her loan in full and on time. Fortunata is a member of the Las Triunfadoras (The Triumphant Women) Village Bank, a group of 19 women from the town of Andahuaylillas, about 40 minutes outside the city of Cusco in the Peruvian Andes.

loans.use: To buy fruit, yogurt and cookies in bulk

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
“Ambitions in life will remain ambitions unless you work for it” said Marlyn A. who is a market vendor in Bagabag Nueva Vizcaya. Marlyn is married to Felix A. Sr. and they were gifted with three children. She resides with her family in Junction, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is an ambitious entrepreneur who aims to become a successful businesswoman someday. She hopes to be able to make her children proud of her. Her eldest child is only a high school graduate, while the two younger ones are presently studying in college. 

Marlyn and her husband work hard to earn a living and give their children their needed support in order to provide good educations. She manages to sell different vegetables, boiled corn, different snacks and also bottled (mineral) water. She is glad that through her daily vending adventure, she is be able to generate around PHP 3,000.00 net income monthly.  This is utilized wisely for their important necessities at home and allowances of their two children in school. Marlyn is applying for a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 from the lenders that she will be use as additional working capital for her business in order to grow and to increase her profit.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Married with six children, Mary A. is currently taking care of five in school. Mary is a 36-year-old petty trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidotes for minimizing poverty, and for that matter, she is very serious with her business. She trades in foodstuffs like plantains.

She started this business six years ago to take care of her home. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She takes stock from the surrounding villages and retails it to her customers at retail prices. This, she said. should enable her to save more to help her husband support the family. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Promise’.

loans.use: To buy larger supply of plantains

loans.name: Kadidiatou

texts.fr: kadidiatou G. est une jeune mére de famille de 28 ans qui excelle dans le domaine de la menuiserie bois. Elle fabrique tout meuble de maison ou de bureau et est l'une des rares femmes qui ont choisi ce métier destiné généralement aux hommes. Avec son activité elle parvient à aider son pére pour les besoins sociaux et prendre en charge l'éducation de son unique fils qui est actuellement en internat dans une école de la région de kolda. Elle voudrait augmenter son stock de bois pour honorer ses engagements.
texts.en:
Kadidiatou G., age 28, is a young mother of a family who excels in the field of woodworking. She makes any home or office furniture and is one of the rare women who've chosen this trade, generally set aside for men. With her business, she manages to help her father with societal demands and with educational expenses for his only son, who is currently in a boarding school in the Kolda region. She would like to increase her stock of wood to honor her commitments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Thuyisighagane Muhindo Gladesi Group

texts.en:
M. Gladesi is a 40-year-old married mother of seven children who all go to school. She also takes care of one dependant.

For the last three years Gladesi has been selling fish and cassava flour. She will use her loan to purchase more cassava flour and various types of fish to sell.

Gladesi also owns poultry and livestock to generate extra income. Her future hope is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava flour and various types of fish to sell

loans.name: Zenia

texts.en:
At the age of 54, Zenia H. is still a business-minded woman and courageous enough to take risks in running a business, the same way she took a risk in re-marrying after the death of her first husband, leaving her with six children. Though the decision she made then allowed her see the happiness that life can offer, she doesn't like to be dependent on anyone, even on her new partner, Anastacio, who is a brother of her former husband, because she knows that she has children of her own to raise and send to school.

Her membership in ASHI and the loans she has accessed since she became a member have assisted her in running a business while Anastacio is a laborer and farmer. He is also very supportive of Zenia and his step-children, as well as their own nine-year-old child. Because of this, Zenia has been performing very well in her repayment, attendance, and business thus making her qualified for a higher loan amount.

Zenia's recently received loan was intended as additional capital for her farming (rice planting) business and hog fattening (backyard pig raising) with pigs to be sold after four months. She will also finance her store to be re-opened. Zenia has to have many business to generate bigger income to send all six of her children to school. All in all she has seven children, however, her eldest works as an overseas contract worker and is also helping her finance the education of the siblings.

loans.use: Additional farm inputs, piggery, and finance re-opening of her variety store

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, age 30, is a member of the Tushikamane borrower group in Kola Morogoro. She is married and has a ten-year-old child. She also cares for two other dependents.

Annah started her own shop business selling rice, wheat, and cooking oil three years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 60,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Annah's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 150,000 in order to buy more commodities. With the additional profit she expects to gain from the use of this loan, Annah hopes to save money and expand her shop business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her shop business

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Jacqueline Fernández de 38 años de edad, mujer esforzada que logra como ganarse la vida para apoyar a sus tres hijos ya que estudian y no tiene el apoyo de su papa, reside en el Reparto Shick, trabaja en una expresa privada. Y también  tiene juego de video para lograr otros ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades diarias. A su hermano le compro aparatos eléctricos para poner el negocio, con este préstamo comprara televisores para agrandar el negocio y dar un mejor servicio al cliente. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios que obtendrá con nuevos aparatos para desarrollarse en sus negocios, lo cual permitirá a sus hijos un ingreso para seguir con los estudios.
texts.en:
Doña Jacqueline Fernández is 38 years old. She struggles to make a living to support her three school-aged children because she does not receive assistance from their father. Doña Jacqueline lives in Reparto Shick and works for a private company. She also operates a video game parlor in order to earn extra income to cover her daily needs. Her brother bought the video game equipment, so she will use her loan to buy televisions so that she can enlarge her business and provide better customer service. Doña Jacqueline thanks the Institution for providing her the benefit of developing her business through this new equipment. This will provide income for her children to continue their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase television sets

loans.name: Dayo

texts.en: Dayo sells childrens clothing. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more children clothes to sell. Dayo is 40 years old and married with four children. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase children clothes to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard E. is from the village of Manggahan, Lower Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 32 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Richard owns and operates a business providing transport services to local community members with his motor vehicle. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Richard joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Purevtseren

texts.en: Purevtseren A. is 53 years old and currently lives with his wife and two of his three children in Zavhan province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. His eldest daughter has been running a small bakery shop in the town after graduating from culinary school in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. One of his sons is a 3rd year biology student in the State University of Mongolia in Ulaanbaatar. Purevtseren drives a passenger microbus in the town. He carries local passengers on the busiest route in the town. He has been in the passenger transportation business since 1999 and hopes to expand his business by adding one more microbus on the route where he sees a big demand for passenger transportation business. He requests a loan to buy a microbus for his business.

loans.use: To buy a microbus for his business

loans.name: Maritza Martina

texts.es: La señora Maritza Martina Espinosa , tiene la edad de 43 años , habita en el barrio el Rodeo , ubicado en el municipio de La Concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes , los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a sus hijas para que logren establecer un negocio propio , doña Maritza desde hace diez años , trabaja como comerciante de electrodoméstico para la región del RAAS   , la mayor facultad que se le presenta es el traslado de los productos , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su suegra . Agradece a Afodenic por la buena aprobación de su primer desembolso, el cual va a invertirlo para incrementar sus ventas comprara planchas, aroceras, cafetera entre otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maritza Martina Espinosa is 43 years hold and lives in the Rodeo neighborhood, which is in the town of La Concepción. She lives with her husband who works and helps with the household expenses. They have two children who are now older and independent. Her plan regarding her family is to be able to support her daughters build their own business. Mrs. Maritza has been working for 10 years as a domestic appliance dealer for the RAAS region. The major responsibility she has is to transport the products, and she began this work with the help of her mother-in-law. She gives thanks to Afodenic for the good approval of her first expenditure, which she will invest in the purchase of new products to sell, such as irons, rice cookers and kettles, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dozens of irons, rice cookers and kettles

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía tiene 38 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia. Hace 7 años sembró plantas de plátanos en las chacras de sus suegros, bajo la tutela de su esposo. Desde entonces, ya no depende de trabajar en tierras ajenas, mas por el contrario, se preocupa de mantener limpia su chacra.
Las veces que tienen que machetear los arbustos para limpiar sus tierras, su esposo madruga y ella le da el alcance con el almuerzo. Al pasar de los años, Epifania ve la mejora de su situación económica y está muy agradecida a sus chacras de plátanos, ya que con cada cosecha obtiene buenas ganancias.
Pero no contenta con ello, desde hace un año atrás, en horas de la tarde vende salchipapas (papas y salchichas fritas) en la puerta de su casa, con lo cual obtienen ingresos extras y eso la motiva a seguir trabajando para el bienestar de sus hijos.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, donde está muy agradecida por tal apoyo de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de plátanos.
texts.en:
Epifania is 38 years old, married, and lives with her two children in their home. Seven years ago she planted plantains in her in-law’s fields under her husband’s guidance. Since then, she doesn’t have to work stranger’s land; instead, she takes cares for her parcel of land. When they have to cut down plants to clean their land, her husband wakes up before dawn and she prepares his lunch. Over the years, Epifania has seen her economic situation improve and is very happy with her fields of plantains (since she is making money with each harvest). But this isn’t enough; she has been selling sausage and French fries from her door in the afternoons for a year. She earns extra income this way, and this motivates her to keep working for the good of her children. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very grateful for the support her communal bank provides. She will buy chemical fertilizers for her plantains with the loan money.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 50 años, está casada con el padre D. sus 8 hijos; D. los cuales, 3 D. ellos viven en su casa.
DesD. su juventud se ha dedicado a los trabajos agrícolas en sus chacras, con la tutela D. su esposo, macheteando y podando las plantas D. café, pues ellos prefieren sembrar este grano, por ser muy rentable, ya que gracias al café a sus hijos no les faltó nada. 
Pero, últimamente ella tiene dolencias en los pies y no pueD. trabajar con la misma facilidad como lo hacía años atrás. 
Debido a ello, hace un mes, implementó una tienda D. comestibles D. primera necesidad, en su misma vivienda, donD. está aprendiendo a sacar las cuentas con la ayuda D. una calculadora para no equivocarse.
Pero a pesar D. estar al pendiente D. su tienda, Rosa no se descuida D. preparar y llevar el almuerzo D. su esposo a la chacra, pues ayudándolo D. ese modo se siente más útil y tranquila.

Anteriormente, el titular D. sus préstamos era su esposo, pero para este crédito hicieron el cambio, entonces ahora es Rosa quien se compromete a pagar puntualmente todas las cuotas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra D. fertilizantes químicos y mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, is married to the father of her 8 children, three of whom still live at home with them. From her youth she has farmed her farmlands and, with her husband's guidance, has wielded a machete to trim and prune the coffee plants, which is their preferred crop because of it's profitability. It has been thanks to coffee that their children never lacked anything. But, lately, she has suffered from feet ailments that keep her from being able to work with the same ease as in years past. Because of this, about a month ago, she set up a small grocery store in her home where she is learning to add and subtract using a calculator so as not to make mistakes. But, despite watching over her store, Rosa does not neglect preparing her husband's lunch and taking it to him in the fields because she feels more useful and calm when she is able to help him this way. Previously, the loan recipient was her husband, but for this loan, they maD. the change and it is now Rosa who is committing to repay it in a timely fashion. The funds requested will be used to buy chemical fertilizers and merchandise for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Pork

texts.en: Pork P. is 33 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She raises animals and grows rice to earn approximately US$1 profit every day. Her husband is a house dealer and makes US$5 per day. This couple has two young children. Pork P. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to make a new investment in order to raise her standard of living. She will use this loan to invest in a fruit stand business.

loans.use: To invest in a fruit stand.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en: Juvelyn H. is 24 years old. She is a rice farmer from Trento, Agusan del Sur. She tills a small parcel of land. She uses the proceeds from her farm to buy food and other basic supplies for her family. Juvelyn dreams of buying more farmland so she can pay to educate her two children. She hopes to receive a loan of PHP 5000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy farm supplies to improve her rice crop.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Maria Lusmila

texts.es:
La señora María Lusmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Jazmines”, Distrito D. Moyobamba, Provincia D. Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 70 años y es madre D. 04  hijos, ya independientes.

María Lusmila, es una mujer perseverante y emprendedora. Se dedica a la venta D. chamelos (mentol, agujas, hilos, pasta dental, shampoo, hisopos, tijeras), se encuentra ubicada en un pequeño ambiente, muy bien acondicionado, en el Mercado Central D. su Distrito, donD. día a día, ofrece sus productos, a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen.
Actualmente, nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien en su negocio, su espíritu luchador y el gran optimismo, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00, comprará  más chamelos como mentol, hilos D. todos los colores, shampoo, pasta dental, desodorantes, tijeras, colonias refrescantes, jaboncillos.

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Ms. María Lusmila belongs to the Comunal Bank "Los Jazmines" ("The Jasmins"), in the district of Moyobamba, province of Moyobamba, department of San Martín. She is married, 70 years old and has 4 children, all of them independent. María Lusmila is a persevering and enterprising woman. She sells personal care products (menthol, needles, threads, toothpaste, shampoo, cotton swabs, scissors). Her business is located in a small place, very well set up, in her district's central market, where every day she offers her products to her steady clientele, among which she is already well known. She tells us that nowadays her business is going very well. Her fighting spirit and great optimism helped her grow independent as a woman and she is very proud of her achievements. With this 2,000.00 PEN loan she will purchase more personal care items such as menthol, multicolored threads, shampoo, toothpaste, deodorant, scissors, refreshing colognes and soap. She is a stable and hard working woman who is thankful for the opportunity that the Manuela Ramos movement has offered her to grow as a woman and small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of personal care items

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es:
Yaneth, de 24 años, es una joven madre de familia que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Miguel, de también 24 años y su querido hijo José de 2 años a quien desea dar una mejor vida.

Su negocio es la costura y su trabajo es muy solicitado en su barrio, ya que es la única que realiza este oficio. Ella aprendió desde muy pequeña junto a su madre y ahora tiene su propio taller donde atiende con mucha paciencia a sus clientes.
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es terminar los trabajos que le encargan, lleva 6 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar todo el día cuando tiene un pedido muy grande, pues es muy responsable y sabe que cualquier tardanza podría dañar la reputación que con tanto esfuerzo a logrado. 
En el futuro, espera que su negocio sea más conocido y así pueda crecer más, para ello está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro y sin descanso.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Yaneth con MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causar problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y apreciada. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará una máquina nueva, de esta manera espera incrementar su producción y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 24, is a young mother, who lives in a rented house with her husband, Miguel, also 24, and her dear, 2-year-old son, José, for whom she wants to provide a better life. She is a seamstress and her work is highly sought-after in her neighborhood because she is the only one doing this kind of work. She learned from her mother at a very young age and she now has her own shop where she very patiently takes care of her customers. What she likes best about her work is to complete the clothing items that they order from her; she has been in this line of work for 6 years and considers the most difficult part of the job having to work all day when she has a large order to fill. However, she is very responsible and knows that any delays in completion could harm the reputation that she has worked so hard to establish. In the future, she hopes to have a better-known business so that she can grow more. To accomplish this, she is willing to work very hard without rest. This is Yaneth's second loan with MFP. She is happy for the opportunity and knows that she must repay on time; she is willing to do so because she does not want to cause any problems for her fellow communal bank members, where she is highly thought of and liked. She will use the 3000 new soles to buy a new sewing machine in order to increase her production and improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves A. is a 62-year-old married woman who lives in Nabantu-an, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Nieves’s husband, Victoriano, is 61 years old and helps his wife run the store. They have seven children between 28 and 45 years old. Some of the children are married with children of their own and most are working.
