Josefa siente muy agradecida a Manuela Ramos por todo lo brindado para el crecimiento D. su negocio y su autoestima.

loans.use: Merchandise to sell

loans.name: Chhoun

texts.en: Chhoun S., 59, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. Selling Khmer noodles, she makes $6 each day, and her husband works construction making $3 each day. Chhoun S. is asking for a loan of $1000 to raise ducks for their eggs. She sees this purchase a good investment to expand her business and she is confident it will increase her income.

loans.use: Purchase ducks

loans.name: Qurbonoy

texts.ru:
Qurbonoy B. lives in Khuroson district. She's married and has six children. She has a secondary school education. She produces dairy products, purchasing milk from local milk-producers, and makes kefir (a fermented milk drink), cottage cheese and sour cream. She would like to take out a loan to purchase a cream separator to process cream from milk. She plans to pay back the loan within five months.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобокалонова Курбоной Тагойбековна жительница района Хуросон. Замужем и имеет шестерых детей.Образование среднее. Занимается производством кисло-молочных продуктов. Скупает молоко у населения , производит кефир , творого и сметану. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить сепаратор для отжима сливок. Погасить кредит планирует в течении пяти месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a cream separator

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem M. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school while the other is too young. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Tha, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support his family.  She is a fruit seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it so she asks for a loan to buy different kinds of fruit to meet her customers' demand. Mrs. Nhem M. and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruit to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soy H. (shown in the picture with her husband on the right) was selected by the group to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are two families including hers. The entire group lives along National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Soy H., 38, and her husband, Mr. Sun Soeun, 42, were married in 1990 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. Three of the children study at the local school; the other child is employed full-time. Soy and her husband have been fishing for eight years and selling the fish at the village market. Sun does construction work as well. Soy is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase fishing nets.

Mr. Seng H., 30, (shown in the picture with his wife on the left) and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Chea, 25, were married in 1998 and have one son and one daughter. Seng has been a fisherman for ten years and his wife has been a garment factory worker for two years. Seng is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a boat for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing nets.

loans.name: Vusale

texts.en:
Vusale A. is 24 is years old. She began her business to keep herself active and busy when she found herself sad and depressed over her old parents' and unemployment.

Vusale has been running her own small business for four years. She rents a store in the local market and sells different kinds of candies, sweets, butter and soft drinks. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 7:00 p.m. Her sister helps her with the business. Vusale and her sister are very friendly and polite people, which has earned them a loyal clientele.

Vusale is now requesting a loan of $1200. She is planning to use the loan to purchase additional good to sell and to be able to continue to provide for her parents.

Vusale promises to repay her loan within 15 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her. She is counting on your help.

loans.use: To purchase additional good to sell

loans.name: Korotoumou

texts.fr:
Madame  Korotoumou Traoré est âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants vivant dans une famille polygame avec son mari, sa coépouse et leurs enfants dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république).
Comme la plupart de sa génération elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école et s’est très vite intérressée aux activités génératrices de revenu , notamment  la préparation et la vente des nourritures qu’elle a apprise  auprès d’une amie il ya de cela 10 ans. Elle est très bien sollicitée surtout  par les élèves en cette période de rentrée scolaire. 
Pour élargir son activité Korotoumou décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis  2 ans . Après 3 prêts  solidaires (prêt de groupe) bien remboursés, elle est à son 2eme prêt  individuel dont le 1er prêt aussi a été correctement remboursé.
Elle compte acheter, 50 kg de pomme de terre,  1 sacs de banane plantin et une importantes quantités de divers condiments alimentaires au marché de Koutiala auprès de grossistes. Elle vend ses nourritures aux abords d’une école au quartier Koko dans la ville de koutiala.Elle a une clientèle essentiellement composée d’élèves et de gourmets.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 60.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage d’utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.  Elle  ambitionne ouvrir un restaurant dans la ville de Koutiala.
texts.en:
Mrs. Korotoumou Traoré is 31 years old, married and the mother of three children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-spouse and their children in the Hamdallaye neighborhood of Koutiala prefecture (the Republic’s third administrative region). While, like most of her generation, she did not go to school, she quickly became interested in income-generating activities, particularly the preparation and selling of food, which she learned from a friend 10 years ago. She is much in demand, especially by school students now that classes have started up again. To expand her business, Korotoumou decided two years ago to join Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans (group loans) that she repaid in full, she is on her second individual loan, having repaid the first also in full. She wants to buy 50 kg of potatoes, one bag of plantain bananas and large quantities of spices from wholesalers at the market in Koutiala. She sells her food outside a school in the Koko neighborhood of Koutiala. Most of her customers are schoolchildren and people who enjoy good food. She expects to make a profit of CFA 60,000 per month that she plans to use to repay the interest on the loan and contribute towards the everyday expenses of her family. Her ambition is to open a restaurant in the town of Koutiala.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 53 años, vive en la casa de su familia independientemente, ya que se mantiene sola. La venta de combustible ha significado para Victoria la fuente principal de ingresos económicos desde hace 5 años, incursionando en el negocio por ser muy rentable. Victoria ha trabajado desde hace 22 años en otros oficios que no arrojaban los mismos ingresos que ahora logra, está muy contenta con su trabajo, el cual empieza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 o 6 de la tarde, siendo la única dificultad que enfrenta, los fuertes olores de los combustibles que a veces la marean un poco, pero Victoria ha sabido sobrellevar estos inconvenientes y superarlos pareciéndole ahora insignificantes. Se encuentra en su segundo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de combustible para comercializarlos y así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Victoria is 53 years old and is living alone in her family home. The sale of fuel has been her principle source of income for the last five years and her business has become very profitable. Victoria had worked for 22 years previously in other occupations that did not produce as much income. She is very happy with her work, which begins at 8:00AM and lasts until between 5:00-6:00PM, with the only difficulty being the strong odors coming from the fuel that sometimes make her feel a bit ill. Victoria has learned to overcome these problems, which now seem insignificant to her. She is borrowing her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and has been very punctual with her payments. With the proceeds of the loan she will purchase larger quantities of fuel for sale so that she can increase her revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the amount of fuel available for sale

loans.name: Ifdal

texts.en:
Ifdal is a 33 year old woman who lives in Tripoli in northern of Lebanon. Ifdal owns a grocery store in where she sells groceries, canned food and candies. She has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase canned food, detergent and other merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Ifdal has requested a loan.
When Ifdal first started her business, she didn’t have the capital needed to start her business because she is a single woman. Her clients are her family members, friends and neighbors. She decided on doing this business because she gained experience by working in other shops. In the future, she plans to improve her business by having more merchandise in order for her to insure sustainability.

loans.use: Ifdal needs the loan to purchase canned food, detergent and other merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thorn P. was born in 1962. She now lives in Choerng Prey Bey village in Kandal province. She is a fruit seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she has decided to ask a loan to purchase more fruit to resell. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

Her husband, Mr. Phorn Chork, helps with his wife's business. Mrs. Thorn P. has four children.Two children are employed in a garment factory. The others attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mrs. D. is 58 years old, married, and has two children.  For the last 26 years she has owned and operated a small, well-stocked store, that is located in the Loma neighborhood of Caacupé.  This neighborhood is full of people and most of the entrepreneurs make and sell chipas.  They are the people who generate daily work and thus move the economy of the area.  Mrs. D. benefits from these workers, because they spend their earnings at the area’s small stores, where they buy the products that they need each day.  

Mrs. D. says that she is worried about the emigration of young people to other countries in search of work.  She hopes that the situation will improve with the creation of more sources of work, especially for the people of the mountain region because there are many young, hard-working people there.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods such as sugar, milk, noodles, rice, meat, and beverages.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena D. R. R. vive Cantón La Nueva Encarnación, Magdalena tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, Magdalena se dedica a la venta de frijoles y verduras .Tras muchos años en este negocio hoy a logrado tener un puesto en el mercado lo cual le facilita vender más rápido sus productos por que sus clientes ya saben dónde encontrarla, es por ello que hoy Magdalena solicita un crédito por que la demanda de sus productos ha ido creciendo y necesita comprar mercadería para surtir mas su puesto y poder percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Magdalena D. R. R. lives in the region of La Nueva Encarnación. Magdalena is 43, is married, and has three children who are minors. Magdalena sells beans and vegetables. After many years in this business, today she has managed to have a stand in the market which makes it easier for her to sell her products more quickly because her customers know where to find her. This is why today Magdalena is requesting a loan because the demand for her products has been increasing, and she needs to purchase merchandise to stock her stand and to be able to make better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Rasool Siddique Masih Group

texts.en:
Rasool Baji is a citizen of a mid-size city named Raiwind in Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for 10 years. Her husband, S. M., sells vegetables. He loads a cart with vegetables and takes it to different areas of Raiwind, calling out his products in a loud voice. Rasool Baji helps by arranging the vegetables on the cart in an orderly way so he can name them easily. Rasool Baji is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables for her husband’s vegetable selling business.

Rasool Baji is the group leader of another three women from her locality. Zubaida Baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Rani Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Hanifan Baji wants a loan to buy bangles to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell; to buy materials for each group member's business.

loans.name: Dora Josefa

texts.es:
En el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua la señora Dora A. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa en su propio tramo el cual ha logrado mantener gracias a sus esfuerzos y su gran espíritu de superación en el negocio.

Ella posee dos pequeños hijos a los que ama mucho y les debe de brindar las condiciones necesarias para que ellos estudien y es este negocio la fuente de ingresos para sus pequeños. El motivo por el cual hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa para comercializarla en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo market in the city of Managua, Mrs. Dora A. works in her clothing business, selling from her own stall which she has succeeded in maintaining thanks to her great effort and her spirit of enterprise. She has two small children she loves dearly, and for them she must provide the necessary conditions for them to study. It is her business that is the source of income for her children’s education. Her reason for coming to Ceprodel is to apply for credit for the purchase of clothing which she will sell at her market stall.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 37 years old and married with 5 children. She has a store where she sells provisions. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Jenny Elizabeth

texts.es: Jenny Elizabeth Alegría R. tiene la edad de 39 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Jenny tiene 4 hijos. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Doña Jenny inicio este negocio por una tía, que le enseño el oficio y fue así como le gusto este negocio además  le ayudaba con la manutención de su familia. Los propósitos de Jenny son de seguir creciendo con su negocio para predominar fuertemente en el mercado. El dinero solicitado es para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, cremas, ropa interior entre otros. Los sueños de Jenny son continuar mejorando su negocio y así lograr establecer un restaurante.
texts.en:
Jenny Elizabeth Alegría R. is 39 years old and married. She has 4 children. Her business is the sale of general merchandise, which she has done for more than 12 years. Doña Jenny began in the business through her aunt, who taught her the trade. It was through her aunt that she learned to enjoy the business, and through it to help maintain her family. Jenny intends to continue growing her business to strongly compete in the market. The loan she is requesting is for working capital, for the purchase of perfumes, creams and undergarments, among other things. Jenny's dream is to continue improving her business in order to someday establish a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Luis Ángel C. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la elaboración de herrería, este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia. 
      Pero le está haciendo falta material eléctrica y poder elaborar unos pedidos que tiene para entregar. Como no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la compara esta solicitando un préstamo y así, entregar la mercancía a tiempo  y sus clientes lo podrán recomendar con otras personas, y su negocio crecerá, tendrá mas ingreso para su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel C. has worked as a blacksmith for over five years. This is the income he has for his family. But, he is lacking electrical material to fill some orders. As he does not have the money to buy the material, he is asking for a loan. Then he could finish the orders on time, and his customers could recommend him to other people. His business will grow, and he will have more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy electrical material

loans.name: Mary-Ann

texts.en: Mary-ann C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 27 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Mary-ann owns and operates a food stall, selling poultry products commonly known as balot in the local community. A balot or balut is a fertilized duck (or chicken) egg with a nearly-developed embryo inside that is boiled and eaten in the shell. Mary-ann has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Mary-ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mary-ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Ma. Shirley

texts.en:
Ma. Shirley is 39 years of age and is married to Nestor, who is 42. The two were blessed with six children. Her eldest child is in high school while the youngest is five years old. Ma. Shirley and Nestor have been running a buying and selling business for the last five years until the present time. They wish to grow this business to increase their income and so that they will be able to support the education of their children until college. They also wish to acquire their own space in the municipal market where they can display items they sell and gain more customers/buyers. These dreams however will remain as vision forever if the couple's long time problem which is business capital is not addressed.

In July of 2009, Ma. Shirley found the opportunity she and her husband were hoping for for many years. She knew ASHI and she felt that the institution fits her needs by offering a loan that suits to her capacity to pay.

As a newly recognized member of ASHI and as a beginner, Ma. Shirley's maximum loan amount is still small. However, if she proves that her capacity to pay a larger loan is increased because she was able to grow her business further after her first loan, she can request bigger loans in future loan cycles.

Ma. Shirley believes that the success of her family lies in the success of her business, and the success of her business lies on loans she can request, therefore she promised to herself and her family that she will use her loan to generate income.

loans.use: To purchase items for resale

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en:
Folashade sells frozen foods like fish, turkey and chicken. Folashade has been in this business for the past two years. She lives in Lagos. She is 38 years old and married with four children. 
Folashade hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more frozen foods like chicken and turkey to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Georgina Marisela

texts.es: Doña Georgina L. es una señora trabajadora que desde horas tempranas se le vanta para realizar sus oficios de ama de casa para luego, elaborar los nacatamales que es su negocio. Tiene 37 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casada y su esposo es ingeniero civil, con tres hijos que estudian, anteriormente ella vendía sopa, inicio a vender comida con la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir la necesidad de su familia. Con este crédito es su sexta solicitud  que invertirá en la compra de azulejos, madera, cielo raso y piso, para elaborar un desayunador  y poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, agradeciendo a la institución por los logros alcanzados.
texts.en:
Georgina L. is a hard-working woman who begins her day early in the morning to complete her chores as a housewife so that she can then make tamales to sell. She is 37 years old, lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua and is married to her civil engineer husband. They have three children who are full-time students. In the past she sold soup but then began selling meals in order to increase her profits to meet family needs. With this loan, her sixth, she intends to buy building materials: tile, wood, dry wall, flooring, to build a breakfast nook to better serve her customers. She is grateful to the institution for goals met.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials, tile and dry wall, to remodel her breakfast nook in her dining room.

loans.name: Alesandra

texts.en:
Since Alesandra got married to Reynaldo, she raised pigs in their backyard. Over those years, hog fattening wasn't really a business for her yet it is just a sporadic livelihood activity. She had no source of capital then to sustain her grow the activity to become a business since she had no access to credit. Her husband's irregular income being a laborer is yet insufficient for the family daily exnpenses especially of her five children who range in age from one to 13 years now. 

Alesandra wanted ever since her livelihood to become a stable source of income or to say a business that is why, In 2004, she joined ASHI to be able to get a loan for a business capital. After loaning several times in ASHI, she had proven her pledge that as a member, she will try her best to use her loan in her business and that she will be able to repay on time. Now, Alesandra requests for a much bigger amount of loan for financing her livelihood activity that turned into a business for the past years. After four months of raising her pigs, she sells them in the market and she profits as much double of the amount of her capital. With large amount of capital, she can purchase more pigs to raise and sell thus making her profit more every four months.

With the profits she will be having in her business, Alesandra wanted to send all of her children to school until they graduate from college to be able to bring themselves out of poverty in the future.

loans.use: Will be use for financing a hog fattening (pig raising) business.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcella T. is married to Julio who is working as a caretaker. They have eight children, six of them are already married. She is sending her youngest child to high school. She hopes that her youngest child will finish his studies so that he will also have a good future. Marcella owns and manages a general store located in front of their house. She has been engaged in the retail business since she was still single. She is now 47 years old and she is still very active in running her business. She has seen its growth and she is hoping to further maintain it and be able to expand into the hog raising business. She is requesting a loan of PHP8,000 for the expansion of her business. She is hoping that her loan will be approved to help her attain her business goals.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Vis

texts.en: Vis C. is married with 2 young children. She lives with husband (pictured) in Battambong Province. She is involved in a business of selling groceries near a local school, earning approximately an income of US $3 per day. To make living, her husband operates his motor taxi everywhere in the town, earning an income of US $5 per day as a primary source of income for the family. This young couple is seeking to improve the standard of living by starting another business because Chhorvion’s current business does not allow her to generate enough income to make a good living and for the future education of their children. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike attached with a cart to stock meatballs that are ready to be fried for sale.

loans.use: buy a motorbike attach with a cart

loans.name: Cynthia Paola

texts.es:
La señora Cynthia Paola es madre soltera ya que hace años atrás se separo de su marido por situaciones personales, ella tiene 2 hijas en edad escolar. Labora para una residencia en el área de labores domesticas desde hace 3 años, y por mes recibe una pensión alimenticia que le proporciona su ex pareja para gastos de las niñas.
Ella esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de uniformes escolares de temporada de invierno.
texts.en:
Cynthia Paola is a single mother who has been separated from her husband for years due to personal reasons. She has two school-aged daughters. She has been working for as a housekeeper in a private residence for the last three years, and each month she receives child allowance from her ex-husband. She is applying for this loan to buy winter school uniforms for her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Francisco Salvador

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Francisco R. se dedica a laborar para lograr mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda la que ha estado dañada a raíz de los fenómenos climatológicos presentados en su localidad.

Como padre responsable, vela por el bienestar de sus hijos y para ello busca la manera de como brindarles las condiciones necesarias de vida. Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para comprar los materiales de construcción para iniciar esta obra hasta terminarla y luego sentirse satisfecho por haber reconstruido su vivienda.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Mr. Francisco R. works in order to improve the condition of his home, which has been damaged as a result of harsh weather in the region.

As a responsible parent, he is concerned about his children’s well-being, which is why he is looking for a way to provide them with the necessities of life. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to get the work on his house done. He hopes to feel satisfied after having rebuilt his dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: Kibimbiri Group A, Kihihi

texts.en: T. Robert is very socialable and friendly. He is 37 years old and married with five children aged 12, 8, 6, 4, and 6 months. All his children are in school except for the baby that is still at home.  Robert has had a retail shop in the Kazinga neighbourhood for 8 years and he is able to make 65,000/=  profit a week from his sales. Robert says that he has many customers though some of them are debtors and these give him a headache. His dream is to ensure that he has a large variety of items in his shop for expansion, growth and saving for a family farm. Robert needs a loan to help buy more shop supplies of different types in stock.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods.

loans.name: Sobirjon

texts.en:
J. Sobirjon is 36 years old. He is married with three adorable children. Sobirjon has always opted to make his life on his land and work hard and grow with it. That is how he decided to raise cattle and dedicated himself to agriculture. He has been doing this kind of work for a very long time for he comes from a family with an entirely agricultural background.

Today Sobirjon wishes to increase the number of his animals and for this reason, he would like to buy calves with the hope of increasing his income and the well-being of his home with the innumerable benefits that these special little animals provide him. That’s why he is requesting a loan of 1000 USD. Extend your solidarity to Sobirjon so that he can move forth successfully and accomplish all his goals.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves to expand his businesss

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more food products

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Doña Martha es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 40 años de edad, junto a su esposo trabaja ya que su negocio es un estudio fotográfico, el cual ha sido su medio de trabajo desde hace varios años, en donde han  comprado, cámaras nuevas, computadora para darle mejor resolución  alas fotos. Procreo tres hijos los cuales estudian para un porvenir mejor y tienen el apoyo de los dos. Sus financiamientos han sido para mejorar su tecnología y estar con la competencia a igual. Es un trabajo que da ya que cada día hay una celebración en las diferentes ciudades de la capital, contenta por que cada día han ido comprando lo necesario y poder dar un buen servicio. Con este préstamo comprara una computadora portátil para scanner, ya que le será de gran utilidad como herramienta de trabajo. Se siente sastifecha por el apoyo que la institución ha brindado para mejora al dar un servicio mejor de su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Martha is a 40 year-old enterprising woman who works with her husband in their photography studio. They’ve had this business for many years and they have equipped it with new cameras and computers that improve the photos’ resolution. They have three children who are in school training for a better future. They have previously received loans that allowed them to improve their studio’s technology to be at par with the competition. This is a profitable business since there’s always some kind of celebration around the city. They are pleased because they have been able to purchase the necessary supplies to provide good service to their customers. They are requesting this loan to buy a laptop computer for a scanner, as it will be very useful for their business. She is very satisfied with the support this organization has given to improve their business.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a laptop computer for their business.

loans.name: Linna

texts.en:
Mrs. Linna N. is 30 years old and she is a married woman who lives in Cheav Bdei Khang Kaeut village, Takeo province. Her husband, Mr. Sophia Cheng, is a teacher who teaches in the local school and gets a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is too young to study or work.

Mrs. Linna N. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. She is also a grocery seller. She wants to expand her business since it is going well, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more groceries for selling.

With the help of her loans from AMK, she has been able to increase her income and the family improves from her business activities.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Rodrigo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Rodrigo A. B., brinda servicio de taxi en Nagarote de lunes a domingo, el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de llantas para el vehículo para darles mayor seguridad a sus clientes que atiende, con las utilidades que le genera este negocio o servicio mantiene el hogar y la educación de su hija. Con los préstamos que se han atendido en CEPRODEL ha logrado mantener su vehículo en buen estado ya que además de las llantas ha comprado repuestos.
texts.en:
Rodrigo A. B. provides taxi service in Nagarote from Monday to Sunday. He needs the loan to buy tires for his vehicle so that he can provide greater safety to his customers. The profits generated by this work are used to support his home and the education of his daughter. CEPRODEL loans have made it possible for him to keep his vehicle in good running condition because, in addition to the tires, he has bought other replacement parts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.name: Hayde

texts.es:
Haydee tiene 28 es una mujer emprendedora y muy alegre, está casada con Héctor de 35 años y  tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que viven en su casa propia, ubicada en una zona lejana de la selva central del Perú.El motivo de su vida son sus hijos, a quienes quiere brindarles todo lo que ella no tuvo, por eso, todos los días desde las cinco de la mañana abre las puertas de su tienda porque a esa hora sus vecinos empiezan a salir a trabajar a sus chacras y los demás establecimientos abren sus puertas recién a las 6 de la mañana. Esto le brinda una gran ventaja, pues adquiere mayores ganancias con un poco de sacrificio, además como le gusta atender y conversar con sus clientes no le parece tan tedioso, pues ya se acostumbró a esa rutina, debido a que tiene más de 4 años dedicada a esta actividad. Por otro lado, su esposo trabaja como personal de seguridad en una mina, por lo que regresa a casa cada tres semanas, pero antes de ese trabajo dejó varias hectáreas de café y plátanos listos para cosechar.
Haydee quiere darle una sorpresa a su esposo cuando vuelva, por lo que mandará a arreglar algunos imperfectos de su vivienda con madera y calaminas para que soporte el invierno en esta localidad.Este es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y está contenta de trabajar en su banco comunal, por ello ofrece un espacio de su vivienda para desarrollar las reuniones del grupo, donde participa activamente.Con el dinero que solicita ampliará su tienda y adquirirá los productos de primera necesidad que más le solicitan sus clientes; a su vez, como se iniciará la cosecha de café, acopiará sus granos para venderlos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Haydee is 28 years old, and she is an entrepreneurial and positive woman. She is married to a man named Hector and they have two young children who live with them in their own home, which is located in a quite rural part of the central Peruvian jungle. Her main motivation is her children, to whom she would like to provide everything she never had – for this reason, she opens the doors of her store at five o'clock in the morning every day, because it is at this early hour that her neighbors leave to work on their farms and other stores don't open until 6 AM. This offers her a great advantage, gaining greater income with only a little extra sacrifice. She doesn't mind it too much, either, because she enjoys serving and chatting with her clients. She has also gotten used to this routine, since she has been running this business for over 4 years. On the other hand, her husband works as a security guard in a mine, so he only comes home every three weeks. Before he started this job, however, he left a few hectares of land ready to farm coffee and bananas. Haydee would like to surprise her husband the next time he returns home, so she will fix a few of her house's problems with some wood and calamina (a mineral) to better prepare them for the harsh winter in their area. This is the second loan Haydee will receive from MFP and she is happy to be part of her communal bank – she is even willing to offer a space in her home to host the group's meetings – and she participates actively. With the money she is currently seeking, she will expand her store and she will buy the basic products that her clients most often purchase. She will also start farming coffee, which she will stock up to sell wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will expand her grocery store and start farming coffee

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. 
Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo, puesto que de las ganancias obtiene el dinero necesario para la educación de sus hijos, a quienes quiere ver profesionales. Maribel viaja constantemente a la ciudad de Ica (a cinco horas de la zona donde vive) para adquirir los vinos que vende, puesto que en este lugar es reconocido por la buena calidad en la elaboración de estos licores. El vino que compra lo trae por galones y al por mayor, para posteriormente venderlo en botellas, con lo cual obtiene mejores ganancias.
En un futuro, quiere tener una tienda grande de licores y tener personal que la ayude a traer la mercadería porque se le hace muy cansado y pesado el viaje sola. Además de la venta de vinos, también se dedica al tejido, elabora bonitas prendas que luego vende a pedido. De esta manera viene trabajando arduamente para lograr sus metas, puesto que quiere consolidarse como una microempresaria exitosa.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y espera ser tan puntual en sus pagos, como lo fue en sus créditos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita viajará a la ciudad de Ica para comprar más vino para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Maribel is 32 years and lives with her partner and her three children in their own home.

She is very dedicated to her job since the earnings go towards the education of her children, who she would like to see become professionals. Maribel travels constantly to the city of Ica (5 hours from the area where she lives) to buy the wine that she sells, since this region is known for its high quality wine. She buys wine by the gallon, on wholesale, and then sells it buy the bottle for the highest profit.

In the future she would like to have her own large liquor store and have staff to help her transport the merchandise since traveling alone is exhausting. In addition to selling wine, she is a weaver, making beautiful clothes to order. Through these efforts she is working hard to achieve her goal to become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP and she hopes to be punctual with her payments like with her previous loans. With the loan she will travel to Ica to buy more wine for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise (wine)

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en: Shamim is a young lady of 24 who lives in Multan, a city in Parkistan famous for its shrines and sweetmeats. Her husband, M. B., drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been in this business for over five years. Shamim has a decorative embroidery business: she embroiders clothes for her neighbors and relatives. She does this work to improve her family's standard of living. Shamim is applying for a loan to buy materials (clothes, colored thread, and beads) to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her embroidery business

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Née en 1952, O. Anne Marie vit depuis une vingtaine d'année au quartier Sainte Rita à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Anne Marie est une veuve qui est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Anne Marie vit donc seule avec ses enfants. Pour assurer ses charges, Anne Marie mène comme activité, la vente de maïs et de farine de manioc à son domicile. Anne Marie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, mais aussi à Sèhouè, un marché de vente de produits vivriers au Bénin. Anne Marie exerce cette activité depuis douze ans environs, et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Dans l'optique de renforcer et d'augmenter la volume de son activité, Anne Marie sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé, en vue de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1952, O. Anne Marie has been living for about twenty years in the Sainte Rita neighborhood of Cotonou, economic capital of Benin. Anne Marie is a widow and the mother of two children, both in school. She lives alone with her children. To pay her expenses, Anne Marie sells corn and manioc flour from her home. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin, and also in Sèhouè, a Benin market selling food products. Anne Marie has been in business for about twelve years, and has already received three loans, all of which are fully repaid. In order to build up and increase the volume of her business, she is seeking another loan through ALIDé to better serve her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of corn and of manioc flour

loans.name: Sialo Ene Neinda

texts.en:
Sialo Ene Neinda K. is 24 Years old. She is married to Kintalel Ole Sinkayo and a mother of one child.

Sialo is a farmer and she does the farming on her own piece of land which she has been doing for the last three years.

She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members in KADET. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend the thirty thousand to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm. She also hopes to spend the other twenty thousand to prepare another five acres of land to plant more wheat. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Sialo's dream is do large scale farming and to buy a bigger piece of land. She is a young hard working woman and with the right resources she can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizer for her five acre wheat farm.

loans.name: Yaa Maame

texts.en: Yaa Maame A. sells panties, underwear and bananas at Abura.  Yaa Maame is divorced and has two children. Yaa Maame has been selling panties, underwear and bananas for some time now. She is responsible for the welfare of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more panties and clothes, which will serve as additional goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more panties and clothes

loans.name: Engracia

texts.en:
Engracia L. is from the village of Lalawan, Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is 62 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. Engracia owns and operates a tailoring business, providing general  alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Engracia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Engracia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Engracia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for buying electronics for television  sets. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Engracia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buying electronics for television  sets

loans.name: Anfisa

texts.ru: Ачелдиева Анфиса проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 23 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 12 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Anfisa A. lives in the Shahrituz area. She is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than twelve years. She rents the small plot where she grows vegetables. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers so that she will have a good harvest to sell.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude was born 1977 and is single. He owns a restaurant and his family members work in the private sector. All of them have to work hard and contribute to their family. Jean Claude employs two people from the community as helpers. This is his fifth year of success in his business. The hours of his restaurant are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening, every day.

Jean Claude is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase foodstuff and other materials to be used in his restaurant. With this loan, Jean Claude expects to save money for his future.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Renacer Ii Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando en dentro del cuarto ciclo y se encuentran recibiendo la capacitación de los asesores sobre como trabajar en equipo y las ventajas del mismo que se desarrolla en el 4° ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Luisa B. con 45 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a vender sus mercaderías (braceros: recipiente de metal usado para hacer fuego de carbón) por la mañana en la zona de Lambaré este trabajo lo realiza todas las mañanas, luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su venta. 
Es una señora muy sacrificada que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de  aluminio para la fabricación de braceros, la fabricación lo realiza su marido quien es herrero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is working in their fourth cycle. They are receiving training from counselors on how to work as a team and the advantages of working as a team. The training takes place during the fourth cycle. Luisa B., age 45, is one of the members. She has two children, and they stay at home while she leaves to sell her merchandise (“braseros”: containers used to burn coals to heat houses). Every morning she sells in the Lambaré area. She later returns home to prepare lunch. She leaves again in the afternoon to sell. She is a very self-sacrificing woman who has a tedious daily work schedule. Upon arriving home from work she needs to do the housework. Everything she does is to get her family ahead. She is requesting the loan to buy aluminum to make the braseros. Her husband, a blacksmith, makes them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy aluminum

loans.name: Cristián Adolfo

texts.es:
Cristián Adolfo G. L., tiene 24 años.  Es soltero vive con los abuelitos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. No tiene hijos.

Cristian es un socio de la ventanilla rural “San Jose de los Amarillos”, que está ubicada en el Recinto de los Amarillos a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Cristian se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y cacao. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz y cacao Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es incrementar la producción para obtener mas ganancias y comprar una casa. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas y enfermedades como la langosta en el cogollo.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cristian Adolfo Garcia L. is 24 years old. He is single and he lives with his grandparents. They live in the city of Ventanas, of the province of Los Rios. He does not have any children. Cristian is a member of the rural village of San Jose de los Amarillos. It is located in the Recinto de los Amarillos region, 90 minutes from the city of Ventanas. There are 23 members in her group and the majority of them are agriculturists. This is the second loan they request through the San Jose Cooperative (Kiva Field Partner). Cristian is an agriculturist, sowing corn and cocoa. He makes his purchases and sales every month in the city of Ventanas. Cristian requests a loan to purchase corn and cocoa seeds. He sees this loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dreams are to increase his production to improve his earnings and purchase a house. The challenges he faces are blights and langosta infestations in his fields. He enjoys participating in sports.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of corn and cocoa seeds.

loans.name: Bech's Group

texts.en:
These are five men who are taking this loan together, all of whom live in the province of Siem Reap. The group's leader, Mr. Bech R., is 19 years old, married and has two small kids. He helps meet the financial crisis of his family buy working as a porter in the local fish market. His wife works with him at the same location. Bech R.’s house has suffered because of the heavy rainfall and it needs repairs. In view of that, Bech R. has taken out a loan in order to mend his old house. 

The other borrowers include: 

K., a fish porter, who is asking for a loan to repair his broken house.

S. will use this loan for his wife to invest in her grocery business.

V., a fish currying laborer, is applying for a loan to buy housing material for mending his old house. 

K. needs a loan to add with his savings in order to buy an old motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To mend his old house.

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela T. is a devoted mother to her only child, Rodolfo Jr. She is married to her loving spouse, Rodolfo T. Sr., a farmer. They live in the beautiful province of Pandan, Antique. She and her husband are engaged in a farming business and also operate hog fattening business. Despite many challenges in their life, they never gave up fighting against poverty.

Tarcela plans to utilize this loan of PHP25,000 to expand her hog fattening business as their primary source of daily income. This loan will be used to pay for more fattening to raise and feed hogs.

During her 6 years at ASHI, she has shown very good performance as a member, and she is being trusted by ASHI for her solid record. Aside from maintaining an excellent performance in repayment, business, and attendance in ASHI, Tarcela has also cared for the needs of her son at home and in school.

This loan will enable her to finally reach her dreams in life: to have a full-fledged pig farm business, a good life, and a happy family as well. She believes that her business will help her family to rise up and fight against poverty, as well as provide for the educational needs of her son until he completes college. She is very grateful to ASHI and KIVA for the continuous love and support of her dreams.

loans.use: To pay for fattening to raise and feed hogs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last three months, Margaret has operated a business selling shoes, clothing, and other items from her home to her neighbors. She hopes to build a permanent shop to sell her products in the future. Her primary business challenge is seasonality. 

She decided to work with Yehu so she can access loans to boost her new business. With the Kshs 20,000 she has requested, she wants to purchase a bundle of tea leaves to offer for resale. 

Margaret and her husband have two children, one still small and the other enrolled in school. The family lives in a rented house that has electricity but not piped water. Margaret's largest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of tea leaves to offer for resale

loans.name: Hasina's Group

texts.en:
Hasina is a very caring lady by nature. She takes care of her family by staying at home and preparing delicious food for them and fulfilling their needs. She is always ready to help her family in difficult times. 

She lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in Pakistan, with her husband, three sons and a brother-in-law in a combined family system. Only her eldest son is able to attend school due to financial constraints. He is studying in 4th class. 

Hasina’s husband is a laborer and he works on daily wages. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her brother-in-law, who is involved in an animal sales business. With the loan, he will buy young animals (goats and cows), raise them and then sell them to his customers at a profit. His clientele base is butchers.  

Hasina is confident that her brother-in-law will utilize the loan money in a positive manner and improve his business condition. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She is a responsible client and fulfills her duties responsibly. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady who has is holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Hasina.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats and cows) for an animal sales business

loans.name: Saldy

texts.en:
Saldy P. is from the village of Brgy. Maddiangat, Quezon, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 34 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Saldy owns and operates a transportation business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a motorcycle transport service. Saldy has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Saldy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saldy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the Saldy's first loan from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Nayima

texts.en:
Nayima is 27 years old and married with one child who is currently attending school. For the past five years, Nayima has been selling products such as shampoo, hair relaxer, and hair conditioners. Her husband works with Nayima in a hair salon. 

Nayima is requesting a loan to purchase more beauty products for the salon. With the profits from expanding her business, Nayima plans to renovate her house and, in the future, she would like to own a studio.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: La señora Guillermina C., tiene 42 años de edad y es originaria de la localidad de San José Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán, un lugar donde es muy conocido por sus aguas de azufre y por sus balnearios de aguas termales. Doña Guille,como la conocen en su comunidad, estudió hasta el tercer año de primaria por que sus padres no tenían el dinero suficiente para apoyarla con los gastos de la escuela, aunque dice que su hija la que estudia la secundaria le esta enseñando a leer y a escribir y que muy pronto ella quiere seguir estudiando para obtener el certificado de primaria ya que poco a poco se quiere superar. La señora Guille esta pidiendo un crédito para invertir en un puesto que tiene de ropa interior, chanclas de baño, calcetines, aretes, diademas, y accesorios y pinturas para dama, anteriormente ella vendía frutas y verduras pero que ese tipo de negocio no le gusto porque a veces no vendía toda la fruta y se le echaba a perder y tenia perdidas con ese tipo de negocio y por eso ahora vende productos que le dejan mas ganancias y no tiene perdidas, ella surte en México y otra parte compra en Zitacuaro Michoacán. Ella tiene con este tipo de negocio hace 2 años, y saca a vender sus artículos en el tianguis de su localidad y en las localidades cercas de su poblado, también dice que trabaja en una casa como trabajadora domestica ya que ella tiene que sacar adelante a sus hijos y nietos. La señora Guillermina es madre soltera y tubo 9 hijos pero 4 viven con ella Gerardo de 18 años de edad el nada mas estudio hasta 6 de primaria ya que se quedo sin vista y ya no pudo seguir adelante, Yuriccia de 16 años, Edwin de 14 años ellos dos estudiantes de secundaria, Alfonso de 12 años estudiante de primaria y también viven con ella 3 nietos ya que hace tres meses el padre de los niños falleció debido a un tumor cerebral, y la mamá de ellos tubo que emigrar a los Estados Unidos para trabajar y mandarles dinero para sus gastos. Doña Guillermina tiene una meta con su negocio que es comprar un puesto de fierro ya que sus artículos los pone en el suelo. Ella esta muy contenta por que gracias al préstamo esta creciendo poco a poco su negocio.
texts.en:
Guillermina C. is 42 years old and originally from the town of San José Purua, located in the state of Michoacán, which is known for its sulfur waters and hot springs.  Guille, as she is known in her community, studied until her third year of primary school because her parents didn't have enough money to pay her school costs.  She says that her daughter, who is in high school, is teaching her to read and write so that she can study for a primary school certificate and improve herself.  

Guille is asking for this loan to invest in her business that sells underwear, bathroom slippers, socks, earrings, hair bands, and women's accessories and makeup.  She used to sell fruits and vegetables but she didn't like that type of business because if all of the fruit is not sold, it will go bad and she would lose money.  For that reason, now she sells products that earn more money and don't go bad.  She buys some of her merchandise in México and other parts in Zitacuaro Michoacán.  She has had this business for two years, and she sells products at the flea market in her area and in the towns close to her.  She also works as a maid because she has to help her children and grandchildren get ahead.

Guillermina is a single mother with nine children, but only four live with her.  Gerardo is 18 years old and stopped going to school after 6th grade, so he doesn't have a plan for the future and can't improve himself.  Yuriccia, 16, and Edwin, 14, are high school students.  Alfonso is 12 and is in primary school.  She also cares for three of her grandchildren.  Three months ago, their father died from a brain tumor and their mother had to emigrate to the United States to work.  She sends money for their expenses.  

Guillermina's goal for her business is to purchase a fixed location since she currently lays out her articles on the floor.  She is very happy because thanks to her loan, her business is slowly growing.

loans.use: Purchase women's, men's and children's underwear, socks and accessories

loans.name: Rodolfo's Group

texts.en:
Rodolfo B. is from the town of Mohon, Aloran. He is 32 years old. Rodolfo is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rodolfo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rodolfo owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Rodolfo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rodolfo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodolfo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3500 PHP from GDMPC. Rodolfo is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rodolfo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en un sector urbano marginal del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región, se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas marginales. Es conocido por su abundante movimiento comercial y de transporte.

Ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta a sus vecinos diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes, ella suele atender a sus clientes con mucho esmero y carisma, por ello actualmente cuenta con un grupo de cliente fieles que prefieren comprar en su bodega. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Esperanza desea implementar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda con la que cuenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 50 years old, married and lives with her family in the urban slum area in the José Leonardo Ortiz district.  It is one of the most populous districts in the region with most of its inhabitants living in substandard housing.  It is well known for the abundant trade and transportation activity there.

She has a small store in her home and offers staple goods and all kinds of groceries.  She is very attentive and caring and therefore has loyal customers who prefer to do their shopping at her store.  She uses the earnings from her business to help her husband cover household expenses.

Esperanza wants to increase her stock of products so she can increase sales and meet her customers' demands.  She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1500 PEN which she plans to use to reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store

loans.name: Noelly Natacha

texts.fr:
Noelly Natacha est une commerçante de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 10 mois et 18 ans.
A l’arrêt de ses études après le bac en 1999,  elle se lance dans la vente des layettes pour bébé, des brassières, des couches, des biberons, couvertures, des draps et tous ce que les femmes utilisent pour leurs nouveaux nés.
A l’octroi de ce prêt elle va renforcer le stock de ses marchandises en achetant  10 douzaines de couches, 10 douzaines de brassières, des lots de biberons, des séries des draps et couvertures.
Très courageuse, elle a l’ambition d’ouvrir un magasin de layette, épargner et faire des gros bénéfices  pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie.
texts.en:
Noelly Natacha is a 36-year-old single woman and the mother of 3 children whose ages vary between 10 months and 18 years old. 

When she stopped studying after getting her high school diploma in 1999, she started selling baby clothes. She sells underwear, baby pants, diapers, undershirts, blouses, baby boots, feeding-bottles and all other items that women need for their newborn babies.

With this loan she plans to buy more merchandise to sell, namely 10 dozen diapers, 10 dozen brassieres, stocks of bottles, sets of sheets, and blankets.

A courageous woman, she hopes to open a baby clothes shop, save and earn large profits in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: Dozens of undershirts, baby pants, sheets, knitwear and baby-boots

loans.name: German Antonio

texts.es: German Antonio tiene 58 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte y billar. El se siente muy contento pues no la primera experiencia que ha obtenido el siempre ha sido una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de este trabajo. El financiamiento es para realizar ciertas reparaciones a su vehículo, el siempre se preocupa por brindar un buen servicio. German tiene los sueños cambiar su medio de transporte, pero debido a ciertas dificultades no ha podido realizarlas, pues el siempre está pendiente de lo que su familia necesita.
texts.en:
Germán Antonio, 58, provides public transportation services and has a pool hall.  He is very happy because this isn’t his first experience he’s had and he has always been a very enterprising person and enjoys his work.

The loan is to make certain repairs to his vehicle which due to some difficulties he’s been unable to do; he’s always watchful of his family’s needs.

loans.use: For vehicle repair.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda C. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old. Esmeralda is single and has one child. To make a living, Esmeralda owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport services. Esmeralda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esmeralda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esmeralda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Esmeralda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Esmeralda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Christian David

texts.es:
El Sr. Christian David T. tiene 21 años de edad, este año va a cursar el 3er. año de Ingeniería Agrónoma en la Universidad San Carlos de Curuguaty, trabaja en el Ministerio de Agricultura y Ganadería, desempeña la función de Técnico de Campo, solicita el préstamo para solventar los gastos de la matrícula, cuotas y materiales para las clases prácticas que tiene la carrera, como visitas al campo, el mismo presenta la codeudoría de la madre, funcionaria del 3er. Cuerpo de Ejército de Caballería.
El joven solicita el crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya, ya que sueña con llegar a ser Ingeniero Agrónomo y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Christian David T. is 21 years old.  This year he will be in his third year of a degree in Agricultural Engineering at San Carlos de Curuguaty University.  He works in the Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock as a field technician.

Christian is requesting this loan to pay his registration fees and tuition fees, and to buy materials for the practicals that form part of his degree course, such as field trips.  Christian's mother, who is an official in the army's 3rd Cavalry Division, will assume joint responsibility with her son for this loan.

Christian is requesting this loan from Fundación Paraguaya because he dreams of becoming an agricultural engineer so that he can improve his own quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to pay his registration fees and his tuition fees, and to buy study materials

loans.name: Miguel Augusto

texts.es:
Miguel tiene 52 años de edad. Es conviviente y reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, el cría estos animales en algunos ambientes ubicados cerca a su domicilio y las alimenta de pastos naturales. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona y a sus propios vecinos. 

Miguel desea adquirir más alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar  a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles. Miguel es una persona bastante tranquila y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien trabajador y honesto.
texts.en:
Miguel is 52 years old, married common-law, and he lives with his family in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is an agricultural zone in the region of Piura, located more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital city of Lambayeque.

He raises and sells sheep. He raises these livestock in some spaces located near his house and he feeds them natural grasses. When they have reached a good level in their development he offers them for sale to the merchants who visit the region and to his own neighbors.

Miguel wishes to acquire more balanced feed to expand his business and to increase his earnings.  To this end he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. Miguel has been a very calm and responsible person. Those who know him consider him to be a hardworking and honest person.

loans.use: to purchase balanced livestock feed

loans.name: Sop Sergne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SERGNE FALLOU est née le 27 août 2009 au jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de MONTAGNE NORD3 qui l'abrite. Il est composé de 14 femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier. Leurs activités sont diverses, elles font du maraichage, de l'embouche, du petit commerce etc.

Madame PENDA N. (debout derrière à droite du groupe sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est divorcée avec un enfant en charge. 


Elle fait du micro-jardin et de l'embouche ovine. Et comme activité parallèle elle fiat un petit commerce de chaussures

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter des intrants pour son micro-jardin, un mouton et des paires de chaussures pour revendre

Son objectif est d'assurer la prise en charge de la scolarité de son fils. Elle participe aussi à la prise en charge de la nourriture de sa famille.
texts.en: The solidarity group Sop Sergne Falloe was born on August 27, 2009 on the day of the inauguration of the Montagne Nord3 Banc Villageois, which hosts it.  It is made up of 14 women who all live in the same neighborhood.  Their businesses are varied: they truck farm, raise animals run small shops, etc.  Mrs. Penda N. (standing in the back to the right of the group in the photo) is the leader of the group.  She is 36 years old.  She is divorced with one child in her care.  She grows a micro-garden and raises sheep.  As a parallel business, she runs a small shoe shop.  With her new loan she will buy the factors of production for her micro-garden, a sheep, and some pairs of shoes to re-sell.  Her objective is to assure that she can care for her son's education.  She is also responsible for providing the family's food.

loans.use: to purchase the factors of production (fertilizer, enrichment, products) to grow a micro-garden and some sheep to raise

loans.name: Juila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHURA 5TO PARADERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pasamanería, ella vende todo lo que es productos de limpieza como detergentes, ambientadores y también vende productos de belleza, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de pasamanería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como detergentes y ambientadores al por mayor. 
                                 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "San Isidro de Yanahuro 5to Paradero" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Julia is 44 years old, married, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling an assortment of merchandise.  She sells all sorts of cleaning products such as detergents and air fresheners.  She also sells beauty products.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and she would like to use this loan to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise such as detergents and air fresheners wholesale.

Julia is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as detergents and air fresheners wholesale

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a 34 year-old father of 9 children, aged 1-16 years.   He is the sole bread winner for his family of 11 people, living in Karuguuza, Uganda. He works tirelessly to see that his family's welfare is well taken care of.  His goal is to pay school fees for his children.  

For 7 years, he has been operating a retail shop, and from it he has been able to buy land and build a family house, despite the challenges of inadequate capital.  Leonard needs a loan to purchase general store items for resale.

loans.use: to purchase general store items like sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David, vive con su  esposa y cuatro hijos de 18, 16, 8 y 5 años de edad, él posee un taller de motos y también de costura, los dos hijos mayores le ayudan en el taller de motocicletas, este negocio surgió por un amigo, que le dio trabajo para que pudieran aprender, desde que instalo su propio taller no tiene un horario fijo.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para el taller de motocicletas, también materiales de costura como hilos, telas, botones, esta inversión será una gran ayuda para él, porque tendrá los repuestos para realizar las reparaciones de las motocicletas que le lleven los clientes, también estará preparado para atender las demandas de costuras.
Él quiere establecer un negocio grande, contar con más clientela, trabajar fuerte al lado de sus hijos y juntos superarse.
texts.en:
David lives with his wife and four children; ages 18, 16, 8, and 5.  He has a shop for motorcycles and also for sewing.  His two oldest children help him in the motorcycle shop.  A neighbor suggested this business to him, and gave him work so that he could learn.  Ever since he set up his own shop, he has not had a fixed schedule.
