He is requesting a loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle shop.  He will also buy sewing materials like thread, fabric, and buttons.  This investment will be a great help to him.  He will have the replacement parts to make motorcycle repairs for his customers.  He will also be prepared to take care of the sewing demand.

He wants to establish a big business, have more customers, and work hard together at his children’s side in order to succeed.

loans.use: to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle shop and to buy sewing materials like thread, fabric, and buttons.

loans.name: María Lucrecia

texts.es:
La Señorita María es socia del banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector de San Pedro del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es cuna de grandes deportistas, poetas y escritores, ha esta ciudad le hace grande y hermosa su gente, su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señorita. María tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, su mamá tiene una tienda  de comestibles en su casa y su padre está fuera del país. La casa en la que habitan es propia.
 
Nuestra socia es egresada de la universidad y está esperando el día para graduarse como nueva profesional.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su vecina, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, embutidos, etc. para surtir la tienda de su mamá.

Su meta es culminar sus estudios ya que ahora está estudiando otra carrera, está en segundo año de economía.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Génesis community bank and lives in San Pedro del Cebollar sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This city is the birthplace of great sports people, poets and writers.  The city is made great and beautiful by its people, its culture and its traditions.

María is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents.  Her mom has a grocery store in her home and her father is out of the country.  They own the house they live in.

María has finished a university course (but has not yet received her degree) and she is waiting for the day she graduates as a new professional.

This is María's second loan through her community bank which she was invited to join by a neighbor.  She will invest her loan money in buying supplies such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats, etc. to stock her mom's store.

María's goal is to finish her studies since she is now studying for another degree.  She is in her second year of a degree in economics.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats, etc.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is a 28-year-old married father who currently lives in the province of Siem Reap. He owns a medium size shop next to his house in the village where he provides a boat-repairing service. He often increases his clients every month because of the good service he provides to them. He started his service in early 2005 and he earns about $4 per day mainly to cover his family’s daily expense. His wife manages the household work and sells some merchandise to earn some revenue. Ly will be using the loan to buy some spare parts for boats in order to provide his boat-repairing service to his customers. Ly has only two school-aged kids who depend on his income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his boat-repair service

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 40 years old. He is married and blessed with four children, ages 16, 14, 10 and 8 years old. He has been providing for his family during the last 12 years from income generated from his retail store. He supplements this income from his salary. He hopes in the next five years to have ventured into the wholesale business. His dream is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

He is requesting 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat and rice.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is 52 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Flordeliza has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Flordeliza has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Carmen  de 39 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de La Matanza que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesanía.

Desde hace 3 años aproximadamente Carmen se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos, bebidas y ropa para todas las edades), su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos diarios de su hogar.

Para poder implementar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería para abastecer su negocio, con el único ideal de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos novedosos para ofrecer a sus clientes y también para cubrir su préstamo. Carmen es una madre de familia que con empuje, esfuerzo y trabajado saca día a día adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 39 years old.  She lives with her family in their own home, which does not have electricity or running water.  It is located in the La Matanza district, which is part of Piura deparment.  This area is characterized by agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For about the last three years, Carmen has worked selling everyday goods (products used on a daily basis, such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, drinks, and clothes for all ages.)  She runs her business from home for convenience, and with the earnings from her product sales, she tries to cover all the daily expenses of her household.

To grow her business, she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1,000 New Soles.  This is to buy merchandise to stock up her business, with the sole goal of growing her business and having more novel products to offer to her customers, and also being able to cover her loan repayments.

Carmen is the mother of a family, and with drive, effort and hard work, she manages to move her family ahead in life on a daily basis.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock up her store.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and the father of an only child. He owns a motorcycle which he uses to make a living by transporting passengers to various destinations. The two-wheeled motorcycle is capable of carrying 2-4 passengers. His wife is also working for the family but it is not permanent work. A total of PHP 20,000 is earned at the end of the month.
The motorcycle has defects at the moment and it cannot function very well resulting in a drop in income over the past few days. To address this problem, Richard joined GDMPC to access financial services. He is initially requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 from the cooperative to buy motor tires and other spare parts to improve the quality of his service and earn more income. Richard can then continue driving. He expects to obtain sufficient income for the family and is planning to buy a motor cab to accommodate more passengers.

loans.use: To buy motor tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Oktyabri

texts.en: Oktyabri is 25 years old and lives with his two children and wife in a ger (a portable dwelling) in the Hovd province of Mongolia.  His wife retails vegetables at the local market.  Oktyabri started his business in 2003 and since then, has done several different types of businesses.  In the begining, he worked at a construction site.  In 2010, he purchased a car, and he has been serving as a taxi driver ever since.  He is planning to build a house and a fence on his new land which he just purchased.  He is a diligent man who is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase vegetables at wholesale prices for his wife who sells them in the city of Ulaanbaayar.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables at wholesale prices for his wife to sell at the market.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 53 years of age and is married. She is married to a generous farmer, working in the Philippines. Andrea and her husband engage in farming, planting and harvesting rice. They will just earn income during the harvesting season.

In order to sustain their daily needs, Andrea’s husband operates his "tricycle" for passenger transportation. Their income from it goes to their daily household use. Andrea wants to repaint their tricycle and change some of the tires for better service.

Andrea is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy a tricycle wheel and paint to use in improving their tricycle for better service.

loans.use: to buy a "tricycle" wheel and paint to use in improving their "tricycle" for better service.

loans.name: Francisca Elena

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 42 años y 5 hijos, es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 4 años. 
Francisca, tiene un tienda de abarrotes y verduras, ella inició su negocio con una tienda pequeña ahora gracias a todo el apoyo que recibió pudo crecer en su negocio, y construir el segundo piso de cu casa, lo que mas le gusta de las reuniones de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las capacitaciones que le ayudan en su vida personal, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar  porque ella abastece a los Wawa-Wasi. Francisca esta ahorrando para poder tener una tienda mayorista.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Communal Bank "Paloma". She is 42 years old and she has 5children. She has is a member of Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 years.

Francisca has a grocery and vegetable store. She started out her business with a small store and today thanks to the support she received, she has been able to expand her business and she added a second floor to her house. What she most enjoys about the communal bank meetings is the savings program and the orientation sessions that help her with her personal life. She will invest this loan in the purchase of rice and sugar because she supplies daycares. Francisca is saving to be able to have a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Nen

texts.en: Nen is a cake seller and earns about $3 per day. Her husband buys and sells cattle and earns about $5 per day. She lives with only her husband and one grandson because all of her children got jobs to do and they left home. Every month, she has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation and $13 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy cattle for resale. This loan can help her husband to continue his career. She hopes her career of selling cakes will get good profit forever.

loans.use: To buy cattle for resale.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a widow with six children. She is a food vendor. She sells banana and camote (sweet potato) cue, rice cakes and other delicacies. Jacinta earns 4,000 Philippine pesos per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar and oil. Jacinta hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for her family to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar and oil

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José Antonio trabaja como maestro de primaria. El quiere realizar un cuarto en su vivienda, a pesar de que su casa en muy pequeña el busca la manera de realizarle mejoras pertinentes. El solicita el crédito para la compra de perlines, arena, zinc, cemento entre otras cosas, José quiere luchar por conseguir todo lo necesario para construir ese cuarto. Sueña con acondicionar muy bien su vivienda y al mismo tiempo seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
José Antonio works as an Elementary School Teacher.  He wants to add a room to his house.  Despite his house being very small he looks for ways to make pertinent improvements to it.

He’s asking for the loan to buy purlines, sand, metal sheeting and cement, among other thins.  José wants to fight to get everything necessary to build this room.  He dreams with furnishing his house very well while continuing to work.

loans.use: to buy purlines, sand, metal sheeting and cement, among other things.

loans.name: Stelamaris

texts.en:
Stellamaris is 65 years old and an enterprising business lady. She is married and blessed with four adult children. She has been running a retail shop business for the past seven months with the monthly income of about KES 10,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her third loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Stellamaris will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar and wheat flour for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will add cereals to her business. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar and wheat flour for her shop.

loans.name: Haytham

texts.en:
Haytham is a 47-year-old man who is supporting a family of seven members. He recently retired from a private company and started his own business. 

Haytham opened an electronics repair shop two years ago so as to have another monthly income beside his retirement. In his shop he repairs mostly TVs, stereos, etc.

Now he has applied for a loan to buy more tools that are required for improving his service, and he also wants to expand the shop space or area so it can fit more electronics and maybe hire someone to help him.

loans.use: To buy more tools for his electronics repair shop.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old married to Sammy who helps to support his family. They have been blessed with one child who is one year old. 

Beatrice runs a boutique and she has been in business for three years. Right now her monthly income from the business is KES 10,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES. 40,000 that she will use to open another boutique. This is her fourth loan and she successfully paid her previous loan well and in good time. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children and to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To open another boutique.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio was grew up in Angola, West Africa and came to the United States in 1983 to seek a degree in Aerospace Engineering and Theoretical Physics. Since then, Antonio has pursued his passion by starting his own business, Authentic Scale, dedicated to the manufacturing of engines for reduced scale models of planes. He sells the exact external replicas of old engines that went out of production 50 years ago. He has gathered a team of engineers and designers from all over the world who are experts in the field. 

The first engine was manufactured and assembled in November 2010 and the first sale was made in January 2011. The business started manufacturing methanol engines, but as the price for methanol has significantly increased, Antonio and his team of engineers have decided to introduce a new line of gasoline engines. Gasoline is much cheaper and the engines cost less to manufacture than methanol engines. He is currently the only manufacturer offering these unique engine configurations which will start production in 2012.

The loan will give Antonio the capital he needs for production of the gasoline engines. For Antonio’s next project, he hopes to pursue the production of full-size diesel marine outboard engines. The diesel boat engine will reduce the fuel burned per hour by at least 66%, compared to typical gasoline outboard engines.
Check out the Authentic Scale website for more information!
http://www.authenticscale.com/

loans.use: To pay for production of gasoline engines for reduced scale models of planes.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une jeune femme , récemment mariée et sans enfants.Elle tient un salon de coiffure et vend également des chaussures et des sacs.Ces deux activités lui permettent de se prendre entièrement en charge et d'épargner une partie de ses bénéfices.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f afin d'acheter 5 douzaines de sacs et 5 douzaines de chaussures.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une cantine au marché central de sa ville.
texts.en: The borrower is a young woman, recently married and without children.  She owns a hair salon and also sells shoes and handbags.  These two businesses allow her to support herself completely and to save a part of her profits.  To increase her working capital, she is asking for a loan of 200000 francs in order to buy 5 dozen handbags and 5 dozen shoes.  Her ambition is to open a canteen in her city's central market.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen handbags and 5 dozen shoes.

loans.name: Oeurng

texts.en: Oeurng, 59, is widowed and resides with her son in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice for over 10 years and is successful in her career. Her son is a Khmer traditional musician. Due to the difficulty in travelling, Oeurng is requesting for a loan of USD 300 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to where he plays traditional music in other ceremonies. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to where he plays traditional music

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es: El señor Máximo tiene como actividad la fabricación de carteras y mochilas de cuero, esta actividad  la realiza comercializando sus productos en el exterior del país, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para el y su familia. El destino del crédito es para el aumento de capital para su trabajo con la compra de materia prima en cuero ya que tiene que entregar un pedido para el cumplimiento de un contrato que suscribió recientemente, es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante en la vida, se siente feliz ya que sus productos se venden en el exterior y esto le genera buenos ingresos, pero también desea que todos sus productos se vendan en todo el país, es una persona muy emprendedora con ganas de crecer mucho en su negocio y así de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad e vida.
texts.en:
Máximo makes leather wallets and backpacks and sells these products in other countries.  This is the main source of income for himself and his family.  He will use the loan to increase the working capital for his work and will buy the basic materials for leather since he has to fill an order for a contract that he received recently.  He is a very hardworking person with great desire to get ahead in life.
He is happy that his products sell internationally because this gives him good income but he also wants to sell his items in his own country.  He is a very entrepreneurial person with hopes to have his business grow and thus increase his earnings and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for leather crafts

loans.name: Lad's Group

texts.en:
Lad is aged 45 years and married with two children. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their family by farming rice, growing cassava and raising pigs. The current business earns them about KHR67,000 per day and they manage to save about KHR20,000 each day after expenses. 
This is the sixth loan for Lad with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to seek for a loan. As the leader, Lad wants to use her portion to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is 44 years old active borrower of Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of 7 children. Her husband is a guardian of her entire family and responsible to fulfill their all needs. Ghazala's husband has been providing the services of book binding for past 1 year. 
Ghazala's husband needs the material of book binding e.g glue, tapes, paper and blades etc for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is not in the position to buy all these things for his business use. Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can purchase all these relevant items for his business to provide better services of book binding and earn maximum profit to make savings to fulfill the needs of his family.
Ghazala is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his book binding business

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: I have been in business for 4 years because my customers perfer the service I provide them and because I have in stock everything they need everyday like milk, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, cheese, beverages, and many other things.  I am a single mother and I have to work successfully to provide for the needs and education of my son.

loans.use: Invest in inventory like cooking oil, bread, sweets, sardines, and corn flour.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.en:
My name is Miguel P., and I am a taxi driver. I began this work one year ago. My clients are very good since I am located near the national university. I earn money through my business in order to support my family. My goal is to keep my taxi in good condition in order to better serve my clients. With the money I earn, I plan to save in oder to buy another car to use as a taxi and in oder to provide food for my two daughters and my wife.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Miguel P. me dedico a transportar personas en mi taxi, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado en el punto de taxis de la universidad nacional, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es tener mi taxi en buenas condiciones para prestar un mejor servicio a mis clientes y con las gancias que obtenga ahorrar para comprarme otro carro para ponerlo de taxi asi mismo alimentar a mis dos hijas y mi esposa.

loans.use: to buy oil, filters, and other car parts

loans.name: Sout

texts.en: Sout S. is 29 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their daughter, who attends school.  Sout owns a small grocery store and earns about $2.50 per day.  Her husband drives a motor taxi and can earn around $4 per day.  Sout S. will use this loan to buy more groceries for her store and to build a simple home for her family.  As her grocery business continues to expand, she would like to build a house to rent out in order to increase her monthly income.

loans.use: To buy grocery products for her store and to build a simple home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cattle Trading and Butchery Business

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the six women of the Urokal Association, led by Ms. Awa D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The project is located in the village of Mlomp, about 9 km from the town of Oussouye. It is intended to facilitate the villagers' provision of beef and live cows. In order to combate emigration from rural areas and to create employment for young people, our group is requesting a loan of $1200 to carry out our business activities.

Purpose: The group works to improve the living conditions of its members, to alleviate the burden of the housewives, and to create employment for young people.

The business activities will consist of purchasing cows, fattening them for six months, and reselling them live or in pieces, according to the needs of the local villagers.”

Original French business description:

«Contexte : Le projet se situ dans l’éco village de Mlomp distant de 9Km de la capitale départementale : Oussouye. Il vise à facilité la procuration des populations en viande de bœuf ou en vente sur pied. Afin de lutter contre l’exode, et créer de l’emploi pour les jeunes, le groupement sollicite un financement de 600 000F pour mener a bien ces activités.

Objectif : Le groupement s’est fixé entre autre objectif : - D’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses membres ; - D’allégé le panier de la ménagère - de créer de l’emplois pour les jeunes

Activités : Elle consiste à acheter des boeufs, les engraissés pour une période de six (06) mois et les revendre sur pied ou en pièce selon les besoins des populations.»

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational lifestyle distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and has restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of five cows, feed and veterinary supplies

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Señor Raúl Q. owns a house located in the area of Rio Seco in the city of El Alto. He lives there with his wife and three children. He works in a steel construction company. He currently has built the bottom level and the foundation for the 2nd level of his home.

The loan amount he's requesting will be used to build 3 bedrooms in the second level.

This is his first time requesting for a loan, and his past credit history make him a good candidate.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Raúl Q. vive en casa propia en la zona de Río Seco de la Ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Raúl trabaja como constructor en una microempresa del rubro en nuestra ciudad. Actualmente tienen construida la planta baja y la losa de hormigón en el segundo nivel de su casa. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de tres habitaciones en obra gruesa sobre la losa del segundo nivel. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Construccion

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en: Alusine started his business 10 years ago during the war.  His business expanded after joining the SMT loan program.  At 45 years old and married with 3 children, Alusine can now purchase more bails of used clothes than before.  He said that, the profit from his business has enabled him to educate his children and cater for other school requirements.  Alusine’s aim is to expand his business and he would like one of his children to take over the business in the future.  He is therefore requesting a loan of $300.

loans.use: To purchase additional bails of clothing to sell in order to increase his profits

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi H., 49 years old, joined the TYM fund since September of 2001. With her first loan of 60USD, she invested it in breeding animals and the yield was very satisfactory. Since the beginning of the third year, she uses her income from breeding animals and her loan to open a grocery store. After 6 years of joining the fund, Mrs. H. uses her loan very effectively. With an income of 150 USD/month, she intends to borrow 875USD to expand her store with more merchandise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị H., 49 tuổi, tham gia vào quỹ từ tháng 9 năm 2001. Với mức vay đầu tiên là 60USD, chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và thu được những kết quả tốt. Bắt đầu vào năm thứ 3, thu nhập từ chăn nuôi và đồng vốn vay được chị đầu tư vào mở cửa hàng buôn bán các mặt hàng hóa bánh kẹo bia rượu, giày dép .v.v... Sau 6 năm tham gia những đồng vốn vay được chị H. sử dụng rất có hiệu quả. Với mức thu nhập 150USD/tháng, dự định trong thời gian tới chị sẽ xin vay 875USD để mở rộng các mặt hàng kinh doanh.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: A. Shahnoza lives in Spitamen and is married with 2 children. She applied to MicroInvest for a business development loan in 2006 and since that time has been a repeat client of MicroInvest. She started her business selling small ware and now thanks to her previous loans has her own trade outlet in a wholesales bazaar, where she trades Delftwares (Delft pottery). She brings the goods by herself from China and that is why she trades in prices that are lower than regular bazaar prices. She has bulk buyers and a good assortment (vases, vessels, etc.). Now Mrs. A. requests a loan of $1200 for importing new goods.

loans.use: To import new goods

loans.name: Huseyngulu

texts.en: I. Huseygulu is a 49-year-old trader who sells food in a small village in the Saatli region. He has six years of experience in this field. He is married and has three children. Now he applied for 1200 USD to expand his business and increase the number of goods he sells.

loans.use: Going to expand his business and increase the number of goods

loans.name: Pura

texts.es:
Mrs. Pura T. C. has always had a keen sense of good business, and when she saw the lack of brick fabrication in her region, she decided along with her husband to begin such a business. Her efforts have made it possible for the business to grow. The bricks they produce are for different uses in house construction and are in great demand in the area due to their good quality.

Pura is 34 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged sons. Her credit—$725 to be paid in six months—will be used to buy more molding machinery, gas to run the machines and firewood to heat the ovens. Pura feels happy and peaceful with the goals she has thus reached.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Pura T. C., socia del Banco Comunal “ Virgen del Rosario” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Bellavista y distrito de Bellavista ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos, ubicada en la carretera a Carhuapoma barrio El Porvenir, producen ladrillos para distintos usos en la construcción de viviendas, considerados de muy buena calidad por los que tiene gran demanda en la zona Siempre tuvo una buena visión para los negocios, es así que viendo la falta que hacia una fabrica de ladrillos en la provincia decide junto a su esposo iniciar este negocio, que a la fecha a crecido bastante. El crédito recibido es de S/. 2,000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses ,lo invertirá en la compra de amoldadores para los distintos tipos de ladrillos que fabrica, y otros insumos para la fabricación como: petróleo para la maquina mezcladora, leña en grandes cantidades para el calentamiento de los hornos. Tiene 34 años, vive junto a su esposo y tiene 2 hijos varones que aun están estudiando, ella se siente tranquila y contenta con los logros alcanzados hasta hoy y con el esfuerzo ha podido crecer y aumentar su negocio

loans.use: To buy machinery and inputs for her brick manufacturing business

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo Rodríguez is married and his wife works as an employee of a commercial store. They have four children; 23-year-old Adolfo Ángel is a day laborer, while 18-year-old Estrella, 15-year-old Cristal, and 12-year-old Eduardo are all students. 2 years ago, Gustavo began a business selling pork rinds in his house, until he started selling more products. This is how he was able to have a snack stand and get extra income to support his family.

Now he is asking for a loan of US $350 that he will repay in 4 months in order to buy a variety of merchandise. With your contribution, Gustavo will improve his life.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Gustavo Rodríguez es casado y su esposa trabaja como empleada en una tienda comercial. Ellos son padres de 3 hijos Adolfo Ángel de 23 años jornalero, Estrella de 18 años, Cristal de 15 y Eduardo de 12 años todos estudiantes. Hace 2 años emprendió un negocio vendiendo chicharrones en su casa, hasta vender mas productos y así tener un snack de esta manera fue obteniendo ingresos extras para sostener a su familia.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $350 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar variedad de mercancía. Con tu contribución Gustavo seguirá delante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa has been preparing and selling a meal called kenkey in her town for 30 years and many people want to buy her food. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize and eaten with fried fish and it is one of the main dishes that most Ghanians enjoy as breakfast, lunch or dinner. It is popular because it is free from food chemicals and affordable to all.

She has caring husband who helps her cook and sell the food. Theresa and her husband are pictured above.They are blessed with six children, who are all in school.

Theresa wants to use this loan to buy more bags of maize, cartons of fish, firewood, vegetable oil, and vegetables to expand her business. She is a member of the group called Odwanwhefo Pa, meaning "The Good Shepherd." Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, cartons of frozen fish, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim H., 28, is a mother of one child and resides with her husband in an outskirt of town. Since 2006 she has worked at a garment factory not so far from her house. She makes about $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and also a fisherman. For sure, it still hard for the family even though her husband has two jobs, so right now Lim is requesting for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband, so he can run a business sometimes when he is free from his regular job.

loans.use: To purcahse a motor-bike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom P. is a coal-seller in Kveth Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her business is going well and she wants to expand it. Thus, she is asking for a loan to purchase more coal to sell. Her husband, Mr. Yeon Srey, is a vegetable farmer. Mrs. Mom P. has six children who are all attending school. Currently, one of her children has dengue fever and Mrs. Mom P. spent $75 for medicines. This is the reason why she does not have enough money to buy coal. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more coal to sell in the village

loans.name: Sultane

texts.en: Sultane I. is a 38-year-old woman who keeps a store where she sells different kind of goods. She started her business in 2002 in her home town Saatli. She is married and has 2 daughters. Sultane applied for 1000 AZN to purchase more food and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase more food and expand  business.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou Dramé, mariée est membre du banc villageois de Kambeng Doumassou depuis 7 ans. Elle veut acheter et revendre des tissus teintés et vendre aussi des rafraîchissements (glaces, crèmes glaces et jus) qu'elle prépare elle même. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. <b> Elle sollicite un prêt qui sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Fatou Dramé is married and has been a member of the village bank of Kambeng Doumassou for 7 years. She would like to purchase and resell dyed cloth and also sell refreshments (ice, ice cream and juice) that she prepares herself. The income from this business will allow her to improve the quality of life of her family. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of six months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The sale of dyed cloth and refreshments

loans.name: Farzaliyev

texts.en:
Farzaliyev A. sells livestock. He started his business in 2000 with growing the sheep. Now A. has the sheep shed and which he sells in the local market once-twice in a week . He likes animals and his job very much which allows him to support his family. A. is 36 years old. He is married with four children. His elder son is in the secondary school.

The business requires a great effort to keep it successful and to generate stable income for the family. Thus, his elder son gets up every morning at five o'clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. Also A. has a car and sometimes makes money by taking people from his settlement to the city or to the closest city. Today A. requests 1200 USD for the term of 15 months. The loan is required to purchase 15 sheep and fodder for them. A. would like everyone to trust him, and he promises to be precise in the loan payment.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Binh

texts.vi: Chị Bình năm nay 53 tuổi, là thành viên của Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Sau khi tham gia vào quỹ do gia đình có điều kiện thuận lợi gần chợ trung tâm của huyện nên chị mạnh dạn vay vốn về đầu tư vào buôn bán các mặt hàng tạp hoá. Hiện tại ngoài thu nhập từ buôn bán hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập ổn định từ lương của  chồng và sự hỗ trợ của các con đi lao động xuất khẩu nên kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển. Với mức thu nhập 6.500.000đ/ tháng  không chỉ hoàn trả vốn vay và chi tiêu gia đình chị còn tiết kiệm và mua sắm được nhiều trang thiết bị phục vụ cho cuộc sống hàng ngày. Vòng vốn tới chị dự định vay 15.000.000đ  để lấy thêm các mặt hàng đồ nhựa và các đồ gia dụng khác phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con  trong dịp Tết
texts.en:
Ms Binh is 53 years old, and has been a member of TYM fund since 1998. She joined the fund with the condition of doing business near the market at the center of the district. Therefore, she borrowed a loan to invest in a grocery store. Currently, in addition to the monthly income from her store, her family has additional source of income from her husband's job and assistance from her children who are also working, and thus their economic situation improves steadily. With average income of 390 USD per month, and after repaying the loans and taking care of their needs, her family is still abL. to save and buy other things to attend to their daily lives. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 900 USD to purchase additional household appliances and utensils for her store to meet the demand of the customers for the upcoming Tet Holiday.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her grocery

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob E. sells planks. He sells his planks to people that are building their houses. He is 34 years old and married with 3 children. He is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more planks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy A. is 21 years old, married and the mother of two children. She is still nursing her youngest child, while the other is in the elementary school. She is a food vendor with five years experience. She prepares and sells rice with stew, and cups of uncooked rice by the road side of Babiani, where she lives. Her food is delicious and has attracted many customers to her stand, especially during the rush hour. She also sells uncooked rice in cups traveling (hawking) through her village. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, vegetables, rice and assorted meat for her operation. Mercy hopes this loan would help increase her earnings to improve her family's well being. She would be very grateful for this assistance. She belongs to the community group called ‘Nyame Nhyira’ which means God Blessing Trust Group. In this group, members provide assistance and guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans, grains, rice, yam, vegetables, assorted meat, etc

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Асакалов Джамшед Булбулович  - предприниматель. Ему  33 года  и у него 2 детей. Свою предпринимательскую деятельность он начал в 2002 году с небольшого количества мужской одежды. Данный момент он торгует фруктами на оптовом рынке "Станция" города Вахдат. У него много клиентов. Каждый день с ближайших районов приезжают клиенты, чтоб закупит у него товар. В ее ассортименте разные сорта яблок, груш, мандаринов, апельсинов и лимон. 
Для увеличения ассортимента и товарооборота, то есть хочет получить займ в сумме 2000 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев
texts.en:
Jamshed Bulbulovich A. is a businessman. He is 33 years old and has two children. He started his business in 2002 with a small amount of mens clothing. At this time he sells fruits on the wholesale market Stantsiya (Station) in the town of Vahdat. He has many customers. Every day a lot of customers come from the nearby regions to buy his goods. In his assortment there are different varieties of apples, pears, mandarins, oranges and lemons. To increase the assortment and circulation of goods he wants to get a loan for 2000 somoni (USD$550) for a 6 months term.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Juana De Los Angeles

texts.es: Juana de los Ángeles M. D. tiene 52 años, está soltera, y tiene seis hijos que trabajan de forma independiente. Por los últimos veinte años, Juana ha vendido productos médicos, y esta actividad ha producido grandes ganancias. A un momento, ella necesitaba un ingreso extra para su familia y fue así que decidió emprender este negocio. Juana hace todos los negocios desde su casa, y por eso, a ella le gustaría el financiamiento de Kiva para aprovechar la demanda de los clientes en su propio barrio. Al final, sus aspiraciones son de mantener su negocio y diariamente poder surtir su inventario.
texts.en:
Juana de los Ángeles M. D. is 52 years old, single, and has 6 grown children who live on their own and support themselves. For the past 20 years Juana has sold medical products, and with this business she has produced large profits. At one time she needed extra income for her family, so she decided to start this business. Juana runs her business from her home, and she would like Kiva’s financing to take advantage of the customer’s needs in her own neighborhood. Her aspirations include continuing her business and daily being able to stock her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abdushukur

texts.en:
Abdushukur K. is 39 years old and has a public transport business. He drives a microbus “Gazelle,” which he bought with a loan from Orienbank. He’s worked in public transportation for two years, and during that time his business has done very well, which enabled him to purchase a second microbus with his own money. He is brigade-leader of route № 2, and drives one bus while leasing out the other. Abdushukur now wishes to expand his business by buying another microbus. For this reason he has applied for a loan of $3000 USD for the term of 12 months. With your support, he will continue to progress.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International 

Tajikistan
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need.

loans.use: Purchasing of new microbus for expanding business

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en:
Batbileg N., 54, lives in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, with his wife and three children. His eldest son, Erbold, and daughter, Azjargal, 21, are college students. The youngest daughter stays home and supports her parents' business.

For the last several years, with his wife, he has run a small retail stall selling luggage and handbags, in Narantuul market, the largest open market in Ulaanbaatar. Based on his experience as a retailer, he imports decent quality, cheap luggage and handbags from Beijing, China, and his wife resells them in Narantuul market.

Batbileg and his wife hope to able to finance their eldest son's wedding and pay for their second daughter’s college tuition. They are hard-working, entrepreneurial family. Batbileg, with his wife, requests a loan to improve his luggage and handbag imports from China.

loans.use: Buy luggage and handbags.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Ayni que significa Ayuda en Quechua.
Juana es separada, tiene 65 años y 2 hijos, Juana tiene un taller de confección de prendas de vestir, alquiler de vestidos de novia, ternos, su tienda se llama la Casa de los Novios, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de una persona.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de telas para vestidos.
Los sueños de Juana son ampliar su negocio, descansar y relajarse.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the Ayni Community Bank, which means Help in Quechua. Juana is a 65-year-old mother of two and separated from her husband. She has a sowing shop that makes dress and rents bridal gowns and suits. Her shop is called Casa de los Novios (Home of the Couple), and she is assisted by another person. Juana is requesting a loan of 1,500 soles, which she plans to use to purchase fabrics for dresses. Her dreams are to expand her business, rest and relax.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics

loans.name: Mohamad Issam

texts.en: Mohamad is a 22-year-old man living in Ouzai, Mount Lebanon. He began working as a car mechanic two years ago, when he started fixing his friends' cars in front of his house. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $800 to expand his business and move it off the street and into a proper garage.

loans.use: To expand his mechanic business and relocate it in a proper garage

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. says; “If you have patience, you will survive.” This serves as her guiding principle in life. She is the loving wife of Danilo B. and they live happily in Barangay Aliaga Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. Through hard work and a lot of sacrifices, they have send their five children to school. Three of them are college graduates and presently working abroad, while two of them are already married after finishing their secondary education.

Their primary source of income is farming. Her husband cultivates their farm, while Erlinda manages their sound system and piggery businesses. She is able to generate an average monthly income of PHP 5,000 from their sound system service and also from their hog-raising sometimes. She plans to improve the business in order to earn more and save for their future. Hence, Erlinda wants to borrow the amount of PHP 5,000 as additional working capital for the maintenance of both her hog-raising and sound system businesses.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es: La señora María de la Luz vive con su esposo y un hijo; Su esposo es pensionado y ella trabaja en una empresa en el área del comedor, pero obtiene otro ingreso ya que tiene un negocio propio de abarrotes llamado “Abarrotes Gaby “ establecido desde hace 2 años, negocio que atiende su esposo y se turnan para cuando ella regresa del trabajo, son personas muy trabajadoras y el motivo de la solicitud de este crédito es para invertir en la compra de mas mercancía y así su negocio crezca mas.
texts.en:
María de la Luz lives with her husband and a son. Her husband has a pension. She works in the dining room of a business. But, she gets another income from “Abarrotes Gaby”, which is the grocery business they have had for two years. Her husband works in the business until she returns from work. Then she takes her turn. They are very hard working people. The loan is to buy more merchandise, which will increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en:
Mrs. Artemia D. decided to engage in food retailing to assist with family finances--specifically to meet basic daily needs and to save for old age. She is 55 years old, married with three children and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Her regular customers are friends, neighbors and relatives. 
Mrs. D. became a member of Paglaum MPC in August 2008 and has had excellent performance in terms of loan repayments. Now she has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP for additional business capital. She seeks a comfortable life with enough income to meet their daily needs and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for snack vending

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Мавзуна несколько лет торгует детской одеждой на базаре. У нее качественный товар, поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Товар привозит поставщик. Она оплачивает транспортные расходы и даёт деньги за товар, иногда она сама ездит за товаром. 
На запрашиваемый кредит она хочет улучшить свой ассортимент и привозить модные, качественные детские спортивные костюмы. Продает детские вещи. Мавзуна хочет получить займ в сумме 5000 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев. Заранее благодарит КИВА за поддержку!
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mavzuna has been selling children's clothing on the market for several years. She has quality merchandise and this is why she has regular customers. She gets the merchandise from a supplier. She pays for the delivery and merchandise and sometimes she also travels for it herself. She wants to use the loan to improve the assortment of goods and bring in modern, quality children's sportswear. She sells children's clothing. Mavzuna wants to get a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni for an eight month term. She is thanking Kiva for support in advance!

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's sportswear

loans.name: Titilayo

texts.en: Titilayo lives in Lagos. She grinds pepper, tomatoes, and beans in her house. Titilayo has been in her business for the past 10 years. She is 45 years old and married, and has 5 children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more food so that she can expand her business and maximize profit. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is married and has two children. She has received no schooling. Nana sells groceries at Cape Coast, which she has done since 2008. Nana uses her income for educating her children, feeding them, and also for the clothing of her family.

Nana will use the loan to purchase the groceries she sells in large quantities for resale at the market. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to save towards building a house for her family.

loans.use: purchase the groceries she sells in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en: Khairullo is 33 years old, is married, and lives with wife and three children. He is a very hard-worker and works cultivating potatoes, an activity which he has practiced for three years. He enjoys his work for the contact with nature and also because potatoes sell very well in the markets and are valued within his community. Currently, Khairullo needs a loan of 3,500 Somoni for his business. With this loan he will buy seed and fertilizer to improve his farming and to get better production. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeurn N. lives in Slaeng Kaung village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land she uses to cultivate both rice and vegetables. She is a 55-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Now, Mrs. Moeurn N. is applying for a loan to buy a cow and two piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy a cow and two piglets for breeding

loans.name: Cerina

texts.en:
58-year old Cerina M. has a sari-sari store in Danao, Panglao.  She has 5 children, the eldest is 33 years old.  Since 1987 this is the kind of business she has been managing.

She likes the program in Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and joined last 2007.  Now she’s asking for a loan of Php 10,000 to buy additional supplies for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en: Feliza P. is from the village of Clarin. She is 61 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Feliza owns and operates a business making & selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Feliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Feliza is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Pheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Pheary M., 39, is widow with three sons. One of her sons is a driver for a company and other two are attending school. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers away.

Pheary has been selling rice in a local market for 3 years. She now is asking for her first loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: Doña Maria Dominga es originaria de la comunidad de Xolsacmalja del municipio de Totonicapan ella aprendio el arte con su difunto padre a momento  del fallecimiento ella empieza ha manejar el taller de la capinteria, con variedad de producto de elaboracion, camas, sillas, roperos, amueblados de sala y cosina hoy necesita del apoyo de la institucion para aumentar su capital  en la compra de madera, clavos, cola blanca, pintura y otros para aprovechar la epoca de verado en donde se tiene en incrementar la demanda de su producto, en los departamento de Totonicapan, Chimaltenango, y mazatenango.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Dominga is originally from the Xolsacmalja community in the town of Totonicapan. She learned carpentry from her late father. After his death, she began managing a workshop where she makes a variety of products such as beds, chairs, wardrobes, and furniture pieces for the living room and kitchen.

She needs the assistance of the Institution to increase her capital for buying wood, nails, white glue, paint, and other items. Maria plans to take advantage of the dry season when demand for her products increases in the departments of Totonicapan, Chimaltenango, and Mazatenango.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Mrs. Uk S., 26 years old, is a young mother blessed with a young child who is not enrolled in school. 

Since 2006, Uk S. has been a tailor for a garment factory and earns a favorable salary of $90 a month. Another source of family income comes from her husband’s work as a blacksmith. Uk S.’s husband has been very busy because he has many customers, but he is still lacking some equipment to perform his services. Because of his needs, Uk S. is requesting a loan for her husband to buy a generator which will supply electricity to his business. 

Note: Uk S. was not available, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a generator

loans.name: Fashoro

texts.en: Fashoro is a devoted member of LAPO. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a transporter. She sells automobile engine oil. She has been running this business for the past five years now. She needs a loan of NGN 100,000. She will use this loan to buy oil in bulk to get a better price. She hopes that this loan will help her build a business that will be profitable and provide benefits for her children. She says thank you to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase automobile engine oil to sell.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Desde hace 17 años en el mercado Central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora María Auxiliadora M. se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de embases plásticos los que son ofertados en su propio establecimiento donde los vende a diferentes precios de acuerdo al tamaño.
Es importante destacar que hoy en día se le están agotando los embases por lo que debe de realizar compras para continuar ofertándolos y por esta razón es que ella muy satisfecha acude a Ceprodel esperando ser beneficiada con el crédito y así realizar la compra de los embases plásticos para obtener los ingresos. Estos embases son muy útiles para almacenar agua, refrescos y cualquier liquido.
texts.en:
For 17 years, Señora María Auxiliadora M. has had a business selling plastic containers in the central market of Chinandega. She sells them in her own shop at different prices according to their size. It is important to emphasize that she is now running out of the plastic containers, so she needs to make purchases to be able to continue offering them for sale. For this reason, she is very satisfied to go to CEPRODEL, hoping to be granted the loan and thus realize the purchase of more plastic containers to obtain income. These containers are very useful for storing water, sodas, or any liquid.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy plastic containers for her business

loans.name: G.s. El Triangulo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Triangulo está conformado por Lucia, Tamara y Paulita tienen diferentes actividades económicas. en caso de Lucia tiene 47 años y su actividad es una pulperia, es madre de 5 hijos, pero todos trabajan de manera independiente y ayudan a su Mama en lo que pueden. por lo que tiene mas de 4 años de tener este negocio, en su vivienda lo que la hecho muy famosa con su pulperia. Por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que solicitan para la buena inversión de sus negocios. Ellas solicitan este capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima, necesaria para sus actividades. Ellas han sabido luchar juntas para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, son personas muy trabajadoras que son excelentes clientes. El deseo de las 3 es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Triangulo Communal Bank is comprised of Lucia, Tamara, and Paulita. They have different economic activities. Lucia is 47 years old and she owns a small grocery store. She has 5 children, but they all work and help their mother when they can. She has had the business for over 4 years, and she is famous for her store. They have all had previous loans for their business. They are asking for this loan for working capital, which is necessary for their businesses. The group has been fighting together to improve the living conditions of their family. They are very hard working people and excellent clients. They all hope that their kids will be able to finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene E. is a 43-year-old married woman living in Prk Bombills, Brgy Old Sagay, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a pig-fattening operation, a cafeteria, and entertainment through songs (videoke).  The videoke lounge plays a wide variety of older and contemporary hits, and is fun for the whole family.  

Arlene’s husband Rolando is 46 years old and working as a laborer. They have two children, both of whom are adults.  

Arlene joined NWTF-Project Dunganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's standard of living.  With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by operating her three businesses. Now she earns an average monthly income of $45 from her business activities.

Arlene is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her three businesses, and it had a positive impact on the family’s living conditions. Now she is taking out her 11th loan, amounting to 9,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her pig-fattening and videoke businesses. Arlene is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dunganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dunganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra C. P. Martha de 43 años de edad, es madre soltera. Tiene 1 hijo menor. Se encuentra domiciliada en casa de sus padres ubicada en la Urbanización Sebastian Barranca del Distrito de Santiago. Trabaja como Obrera de campo en una empresa agroindustrial desde hace 10 años. Adicionalmente percibe otros ingresos de pensión por alimentación. Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo esta sacando adelante a su hijo y a podido adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para mejoramiento de vivienda ya que en el terremoto del 2007  se vio efectada. Su sueño es terminar de construir la vivienda para lograr una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Martha is a 43-year-old single mother with one young son. She lives in her parents' home in the Sebastian Barranca area of the district of Santiago. She has worked in the field for an agroindustrial company for the past 10 years. She also receives additional income from a pension, which she uses to buy food. Thanks to her hard work she continues making headway with her son and has been able to acquire her goods. She is requesting the loan to make improvements to her home, which was damage in an earthquake in 2007. Her dream is to finish building the home so she can have a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support she receives through microfinancing.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Giovanni Martin

texts.es: El Sr. Giovanni M. González, trabaja en mantenimiento Industrial en una zona residencial, es padre de dos hijos en edad escolar, diario se traslada al ray hasta su centro de trabajo anteriormente se desempeñaba como ayudante de camión vendiendo materiales de construcción en la zona que hoy es su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Giovanni M. González works in industrial maintenance in a residential area. He is the father of two children of school age. Every day he travels to his work center. In the past, he worked as an assistant on a truck selling construction materials in the area where he now works.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, zinc, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana T. is from the village of Puntod. She is 52 years old. Juana is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a business planting & harvesting rice for sale. Juana has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Juana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Juana is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Juana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Mrs. Arlene C. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 38 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she manages her business, which is a sari-sari (variety) store. Her main source of income comes from her boarding house. She has been engaged her business for more than three years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month. She joined PMPC, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial support and to engage in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 10,000 PHP taken from PMPC. This new loan of 15,000 PHP is for the expansion of her business and to have additional capital. She plans that the additional revenue generated from the business will help improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Seelawathi

texts.en:
Seelawathi is a 41-year-old married woman living in the town of Telijjawila, part of the Matara area of Sri Lanka.  She has five children: two sons and three daughters ranging from age five to sixteen.

Seelawathi has requested a 20,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to assist in her husband's business. He sells vegetables and fruits, such as coconuts.  She helps her husband, and they have been doing this business for twenty years.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To support the vegetable business

loans.name: Amélé

texts.en: Madame Amélé A. sells maize and coal at her shop in Lomé, Togo. She is 45 years-old, and married with three children. Amélé has been selling maize and coal since 1999. This will be her first loan from Kiva partner WAGES. She has requested 500,000 CFA to purchase more maize and coal.

loans.use: To purchase maize and coal.

loans.name: Julian Edmundo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua se reúne en la ciudad de Chichero del departamento del Cusco,  esta ciudad es más conocida por las ruinas Incas que tiene, cuenta la historia que en tiempos pasados cuando aun no era ciudad en lo que ahora son sus calles había la casa del Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui”.  Es también muy interesante esta población no sólo por ruinas y el templo, sin por los trajes y costumbres; además de su colorida y concurrida feria dominical. 

Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Julián, tiene 38 años,  es casado, tiene 4 hijos,  vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, él se dedica a trabajar en el grifo “Pisis” como administrativo de 7am hasta las 4pm. Julián y su esposa tienen un negocio familiar de elaboración de textil. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito, él quiere hacer tejidos de lana y desea compra lana de alpaca y tintes naturales como por  ejemplo la cochinilla. El anhelo del  socio es abrir una tienda artesanal donde puede expender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Mateo Pumacahua Community Bank meets in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. This city is most well-known for its Inca ruins, which tell the story of times past, when on what now the city streets, there was the house of the Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui.” This area is also interesting not only because of its ruins and temple, but also because of the local clothing and customs, and its colorful and well-attended Sunday market. Upon visiting the Mateo Pumacahua Community Bank, we spoke with the bank member Julián. He is 38 years old and married with four children, and he lives in the city of Chinchero, in the department of Cusco. He works as a clerk at the Pisis gas station from 7am until 4pm. Julián and his wife have a family business in textile production. He has already been working in the business for several years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. Being a member of the Fundación has helped him substantially to improve and make his business grow. With this new loan, he would like to buy alpaca wool and natural dyes - for example, cochinilla, a red plant-based dye - to make weavings. Julián’s wish is to be able to open an artisanal shop where he can sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural dyes and alpaca wool

loans.name: Yaneth Nathaly

texts.es: Yaneth Nathaly P. D. A. D. 25 años D. edad, es una mujer joven pero muy responsable con su hogar y su familia, ella vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa privada, y junto a sus tres hijos D. 5, 4 y 3 años D. edad, D. los cuales los dos mayores van al kinder, Yaneth resiD. junto a su familia en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una venta D. cosméticos para el cuidado D. la piel, crema para pies, manos y rostro, perfumes, maquillaje, perfumería y otros más, así mismo comercializa ropa para mujeres y niños, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se encarga D. comercializar su ropa en diferentes departamentos D. El Salvador tales como Cuscatlán, Sonsonate, San Miguel y otros más, ella visita un departamento diferente una vez a la semana y el resto D. días venD. sus productos en colonias, municipios y cantones del departamento D. San Salvador. Su negocio es muy productivos, por lo que desea poder contar con más productos, es por ello que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más cosméticos y diferentes estilos D. ropa, D. forma que pueda contar con más clientes quienes le permitan aumentar sus ganancias, D. esta forma ella espera poder invertir en su hogar y así mismo compartir más gastos junto a su esposo para tener una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Yaneth Nathaly P. D. A. is 25 years old; she is a young woman, but very responsible with her home and family. She lives with her husband who works for a private business, and together they have three children ages 5, 4 and 3. The older two children go to day care. Yaneth lives with her family in an apartment in San Salvador. She owns a cosmetics shop selling skin care products, creams for feet, face and hands, perfumes, make-up and other things. She also sells women's and children's clothing. She is very hardworking, and she's in charge of marketing her clothing to different stores in El Salvador area such as: Cuscatlán, Sonsonate, San Miguel and many others. She visits different stores once a week, and the rest of the days she sells her products in the neighborhoods and business districts in the San Salvador state. Her business is very productive, and for this reason she wants to be able to amass more products. For this reason, she is asking for a loan so that she can buy more cosmetics, and different clothing and styles to appeal to more clients. That will allow her to increase her earnings. She hopes to invest in her home and also share in the household expenses together with her husband to have a better life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Patricia M., age 35, is married with three children aged 15, 11, and 6 years. She has had a pharmacy business for 10 years now. She works from 8am to 10pm daily and she is able to make monthly profits of about $262.

This will be Patricia’s second Motisha loan (Motisha loans are for clients with good payment histories) from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more medicine and has paid it back successfully. She hopes for a loan to pay for the laborers who are building her small house.

Patricia will share this loan with her loan group Tanzanite, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Patricia is the first on the right front row.

loans.use: To increase stock by buying more medicine.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a resident of the city of Lahore with her husband and children. She is a housewife and stays at home to manage the household chores and take care of her family and home. Her husband sells construction supplies. He has had this business for the last nine years. He has a shop in the main market which enables him to reach more customers to sell his supplies. His business is not doing well these days, because he does not have sufficient stock to meet the orders of his customers. 

Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband.
