With the loan, her husband will buy construction supplies such as cement and sand in bulk for his shop which will increase his chance of making more money. Rukhsana is sure that her husband is a very hard worker and he will never let her down.

Note: In this photo, they are standing in Bushra's grocery shop (a group member).

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua A. is married and takes care of six children. She has been through senior high school. Efua sells yams, corn dough, smoked fish and other edible items at Takoradi. Her husband is a mason. Efua uses her earnings in enhancing the welfare of her dependents. Efua will use the loan to purchase additional foodstuffs for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase additional foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery, de 27 años, vive a lado de su madre y de sus 2 pequeños  hijos, pues su esposo trabaja en el extranjero en busca de un futuro mejor. Esta alegre y trabajadora mujer se dedica a las labores agrícolas, y desde muy pequeña observaba como realizaban las labores sus padres, y así aprendió las técnicas necesarias para cultivar con mucho cuidado la tierra. Y en la actualidad siembra papa y olluco, con la ayuda de operarios que contrata, logra obtener una mayor producción. Cuando es tiempo de cosecha recoge todos sus productos y los coloca en pesados sacos, en el que son trasladados en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, donde los vende a regulares precios. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de carne de carnero al por menor, así se genera mejores ganancias. De esta manera ha sacado adelante a sus hijos, es por ello que tiene planeado comprar algunas cabezas de reses para aumentar su producción y ganar más. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el credito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Mery tiene planeado invertir el crédito que solicita en la compra de carne que luego los  comercializará a sus comerciantes minoritarios, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Mery is 27 years old and lives with her mother and her two young children because her husband works abroad in search of a better future. This cheerful and hardworking woman earns her living by farming. As a little girl, Mery watched her parents complete their work. She learned the techniques required to cultivate and care for the land. Mery currently grows potatoes and ulluco with the help of hired laborers in order to obtain the greatest production. During the harvest season, all of her products are gathered and placed in heavy sacks before being transported to the wholesale market in the city where they are sold at regular prices. In addition, Mery sells mutton on a small scale in order to generate additional income so that her children can get ahead. She has plans to buy a few heads of cattle so that she can increase her production and earn more.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. Mery promises to be prompt with her loan payments. She expresses her thanks to everyone who made this loan possible since it will allow her to continue working. Mery plans to invest the loan she requested in the purchase of meat that she will sell later to the informal merchants who have placed several orders with her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat for distribution to the informal merchants

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Like most people in Surallah, 63-year-old Antonio S. is in the farming business. He is married and has two grown children. He wants to be of help to his children and their families. 

He applied for a loan to finance his farm's maintenance and will buy fertilizer, seedlings and other farming tools. He wants to increase the profitability of his business. His income will go toward his family’s daily needs, to help his children and as savings for the future.

loans.use: purchase of fertilizers, seedlings and other farming tools

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: Estrelita A. is from the village of Bannagao. She is 59 years old and is married with seven adult children. Estrelita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Estrelita is very positive that her business will continuously progress. In 2006, Estrelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Estrelita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 9th from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana M. is married and has two children. She prepares Fante kenkey at Abura to sell. Nana uses her income to help her husband take care of her family. Nana will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to prepare her kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to prepare her kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
This is Daisy B., 30, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Napoleon B., Jr. and mother to their only child. By the grace of God, Daisy has managed to support her child. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Daisy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them at a piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 14,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Daisy dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean S. is a 26-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer in the province of Kompong Cham since she was single. She is earning approximately $1.80 a day to support her family. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a local farmer and fisherman also. The couple has two children who are studying in school. 

This approaching fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but the family is lacking fishing tools. Therefore, Kean S. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support his business activities. She proposes to use the remainder of loan to purchase a sack of fertilizer and insecticides for her crop. 

Kean S. was not available the day of the photo, so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Raisa Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Américas.
 
Para Raisa este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado ya que a través de los créditos a podido incrementar sus ventas y así obtener ingresos que le sirven para poder seguir adelante en sus estudios. Ella tiene 20 años de edad, está soltera y estudia el segundo semestre de auditoría en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí. Vive en la casa de sus padres que la apoyan en lo que ellos pueden.

Se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Nature Garden, trabaja todos los días tres horas por día y también en las noches en la universidad, donde les vende a sus compañeras de clases y profesoras. Entre los productos que mas vende están la linaza, shampo para la caída del cabello, gel reductor, entre otros. Los productos los recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar gel reductor, linaza y todos los productos que ella vende. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y tener un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the Las Américas communal bank meets every two weeks.

For Raisa this is her third cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it because of the help it’s given her because she’s been able to increase sales thanks to the loans thus obtaining income that has allowed her to continue with her studies.  

She is 20 years old, single and is in the second semester of Accounting at the Manabí Technical University.  She lives with her parents who support her in every way they can.

She sells natural products of the Nature Garden brand.  She works every day, three hours per day and also at nights at the university where she sells to her classmates and professors.  Among the products that sell best are the flax seed, shampoo to prevent hair loss and reducing gel, among others. She gets her products from a supplier in Portoviejo.

This loan is to buy reducing gel, flax seed and all the products she sells.  Her dreams are to finish her career and to have a good job.

loans.use: To buy Natural Garden brand products like reducing gel and flax seed.

loans.name: Herberte S.

texts.fr: Herberte S. est née le 02 Septembre 1979 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Herberte est mariée à un couturier du nom de Félix et est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Herberte n'est pas allée à l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Herberte vend depuis cinq ans environs, des ustensiles de cuisine (glacières, bols en séries, etc.) de façon ambulante et aussi à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Herberte fait de la restauration. Herberte s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la quatrième fois que Herberte sollicite auprès de ALIDé un crédit, en vue d'augmenter son stock de produits pour mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Herberte S. was born September 2, 1979 in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. Herberte is married to a dressmaker named Felix, and she is the mother of two children, one of which attends school. The couple provide together for their family’s needs. 

Herberte never went to school. To support herself and her family, she started selling kitchen equipment (coolers, bowl sets, etc.) door to door and from her home bout five years ago. As a sideline, Herberte also works in the restaurant business. She gets her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. 

This is Herberte’s fourth time seeking a loan from ALIDé to increase her stock of merchandise and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen equipment

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio G. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. He is 57 years old. Virgilio is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Virgilio owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as dry goods in the local community. Virgilio has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Virgilio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgilio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgilio is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Virgilio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Ligaya's Group

texts.en:
Ligaya A. is from the village of Brgy. Escoting, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 50 years old. Ligaya is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ligaya is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ligaya owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Ligaya has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ligaya joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ligaya has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ligaya is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ligaya from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Fet Shameness Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Fet Shameness” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 400,000 SLL for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

Mabinty K. is the leader of this group. The thirty year old is a widow with three children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Mabinty has been a businesswoman since 1991. She sells firewood. With her share of this loan, she will buy firewood in large quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy firewood in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Jenny Gisela

texts.es:
Jenny de 21 años, ella tiene una papelería. Hace años para poder mantener y pasar más tiempo con sus dos hijos comenzó a invertir dinero en papelería con ayuda de su esposo.  

Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación a podido surtir su papelería. En l actualidad trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con el comprando con el préstamo papelería, cuadernos, plumas. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio y tener un almacén.
texts.en:
Jenny is 21 years old and manages a stationery shop. She started this business a few years ago so that she could take care of and spend more time with her two children. Jenny invested money in stationery so that she could help her husband.

Over time and with hard work and dedication, Jenny was able to stock her stationery sthop. She currently works from 8am to 8pm every day. Jenny has many aspirations for her business. She wants to use this loan to buy stationery, notebooks, and pens. In the future, she wants to expand her business and open a warehouse.

loans.use: Purchase stationery, notebooks, and pens

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en: Rosario is a married woman who lives in Puerto Princesa, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a general store and a buy and sell of dry goods business. Her husband Michael, who is 31 years old, works as a company driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 3 and 7 years old. Rosario joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosario has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of her business and the education of her children. Rosario is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Neemat

texts.ar: نعمات في عمر 46 سنة تعمل في التجميل النسائي لها في عملها 33 سنة تحب عملها وتجيده كثيرا هي متطورة نشيطة ومحبة للعمل متزوجة ولها اربع اولاد تريد لهم العيش الجيد والكريم تسعى الى زيادة مدخول عائلتها وتطويره تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى مساعدة ابنتها على دفع تكاليف الزواج ومساعدتها فهي متكفلة في دفع مصاريف اولادها واعالتهم
texts.en: Neemat is 46 years old and married with four children. She works in a beauty salon and has been doing so for 33 years. She is skillful and enthusiastic about her work. She also likes to keep up to date with hair styles and loves her job. She aspires to increase her income and thereby secure a comfortable standard of living for her family. With this loan she wants to help pay for her daughter's wedding as she is responsible for her children's wedding expenses.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is from the village of Maribojoc,Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old, married and has three adult children. Lorna runs a business venture raising crops in the local community.

Lorna has been engaged in her business for 30 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities. Lorna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers.

Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase additional fertilizers. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Lorna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Sergio Bosco

texts.es:
Sergio de 47 años, es un hombre trabajador que laboro para un compañía donde lo liquidaron y de allí se compro una camioneta y empezó a realizar fletes años después vendió la camioneta para comprarse el auto con el actualmente trabaja.

Labora de lunes a domingo desde las 7h00 am a 8h00 pm. Es viudo u tiene una hija de 16 años que todavía estudia. Con el préstamo quiere arreglar su auto para así aumentar su productividad ya que algunas veces le está fallando. Una de sus metas es terminar su vivienda para darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Sergio, age 47, is a hardworking gentleman who was employed for a company that went out of business. While working there, he purchased a truck for carrying freight. Years later, he sold the truck and purchased a car that he currently uses for work.

Sergio works Monday through Sunday from 7am to 8pm. He is a widower and has a 16-year-old daughter who is still in school. Sergio will use this loan to repair his automobile so that he can increase his productivity which has been lacking at times. One of his goals is to finish his home so that he can provide the best for his daughter.

loans.use: to pay for auto repairs.

loans.name: Sayhua Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia D. Urubamba y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria: es soltera y tiene 34 años D. edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos; 14, 12, 10 años D. edad; la socia trabaja en el municipio ella está en el área D. almacén; La socia alterna la artesanía, ella en realidad trabaja con este alternativa D. ingresos económicos en la época D. junio, la socia solicita para poder comprar los diferentes materiales para elaborar bisutería, ella hace aretes, collares, pulseras, llaveros y muchas cosas más, la socia también venD. tejidos, ella en este mes se abastece para poder empezar a trabajar en sus horas libres y llegado el mes D. junio la socia los venderá, aprovechando la época D. temporada alta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para elaborar trabajos manuales y tejidos.
Los otros socios trabajan en diferentes actividades siendo la primera la agricultura, criado D. animales menores, obras, tienda D. abarrotes, restaurantes entre otros menores.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha y feliz con el préstamo a otorgar, comprometiéndose a cumplir D. forma disciplinada sus pagos en los plazos establecidos.
 
La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. dicho préstamo D. forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Sayhua" community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Maria is 34 years old, single and has three children aged 14, 12 and 10.  She works for the town council, in warehousing.  Maria also makes handicrafts.  She makes income in this way in the month of June.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the different materials she needs to make jewelry.  She makes earrings, necklaces, bracelets, keychains and many other items.  She also sells knitted products.  This month is when Maria stocks her business so that she can start working in her free time.  When June comes she will sell her products, taking advantage of the high season.  Maria is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise so that she can make handicrafts and knitted items.

The other members of this group work in different businesses: farming, raising animals, construction work, grocery store, restaurant and others.

Maria is happy that she is being granted this loan and pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner, according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy different materials for making jewelry (earrings, necklaces and bracelets)

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is a thirty-three-year-old married man with one child. He rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. Tom has been dealing in stationery and computer services for three years. He started with one computer and capital of 800,000 shillings and now has two computers, a scanner, two printers and a binding machine. He has limited funds to meet his expenses. His vision is to own a big staionery firm and to build a house. Tom wants the loan to buy stationery materials.

loans.use: to buy stationery materials

loans.name: Los Chupaquinitos Group

texts.es:
La Señora Haydee tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo menor en etapa escolar, Haydee es socia de la alcancia comunal los "Chupaquinitos", se dedica a la compra y venta de animal vacuno en pie, ella se traslada durante las semanas en las  diferentes ferias de su centro poblado  para realizar la compra de animales y revender a los carniceros y asi generar sus propios ahorros para su canasta familiar y para los gastos de estudio de su hijo. Solicito el préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo, el prestamo lo utilizara para la compra de insumos de engorde y alimentacion para el ganado.
la Sra. Haydee se encuentra al centro de las dos señoras de la foto principal esta con chompa de color gris.
texts.en:
Haydee is 35 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son who is in school.  She is a member of "Los Chupaquinitos" community bank and her business is buying and selling cattle.  During the week, she travels to the different livestock markets in her area to buy animals and re-sell to butchers.  In this way, she makes her own savings with which to cover her family's basic expenses and also her son's educational expenses.

Haydee requested this loan to increase her working capital and will use the loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her cattle. Haydee is located in the center of the two women in the main picture and is wearing a gray sweatshirt.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her cattle

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes, de 41 años de edad, convive con su pareja Edison y tienen dos hijos en etapa escolar Walter de 19 años y Farid de 10 años de edad. Juntos residen en la localidad de San Antonio, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. Mercedes, recalca que todo lo que va obteniendo es a base de tenacidad y entrega a sus cultivos de cacao, café y ajonjolíes es por ello que trata de dar el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones y bajo esa premisa es que muchos de sus compradores se han sentido satisfechos  por la calidad de sus productos agrícolas. Sin embargo ella trata de esmerarse lo mas posible que pueda; es por ello que le dedica mucho tiempo a su producto, conjuntamente con la ayuda de su pareja, sin embargo en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones, para que de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en la extracción  de su producto final y fruto a su esfuerzo cotidiano está obteniendo buenos ingresos económicos. Mercedes con el crédito solicitado comprará más plantas de cacao ya que tiene previsto injertarlos a medida que van desarrollando. Su plan a futuro es invertir sus ingresos en otro tipo de negocios como crianza de reses. Este es será su primer crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo financiero y esta dispuesta a cumplir puntualmente con el rol de sus cronogramas de pago. Con el crédito adquirirá plantas de cacao para ampliar sus cultivos y así obtener mayores ingresos posteriormente.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 41 years old.  She lives with her partner, Edison, and they have two children who are in school: 19 year-old Walter and 10 year-old Farid.  They live together in their own home, in the town of San Antonio, which is located in the beautiful jungle of Ayacucho.

Mercedes stresses that everything that she obtains is through tenacity and the dedication she puts into caring for her cacao, coffee and sesame crops.  She tries to provide the best possible care for her plantations and, under that premise, many of her customers are satisfied with the quality of her produce but she still puts as much care and attention into her work as she possibly can.  She spends a lot of time working on her crops, with her partner's help.  However, at harvest time, she needs the help of laborers who can make it easier to harvest the final product.  As a result of her daily efforts, Mercedes is making a good income.

Mercedes will use the loan she has requested to buy more cacao plants since she plans to graft them as they develop.  Her plan for the future is to invest her profits in another type of business such as raising cattle.

This is Mercedes' first loan and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support.  She is prepared to make her repayments punctually, according to schedule.  Mercedes will use her loan to buy cacao plants so that she can expand her crops and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Felixberta

texts.en:
Felixberta is 41 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Felixberta works very hard to provide for them.

Felixberta runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like candy, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Felixberta has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, biscuits, noodles, snack food, etc. 

Felixberta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items  like candy, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 44 años y vive feliz con su esposo Amancio de 50 años. Con él tienen 3 hermosas hijas que son su orgullo; Verónica, Deysi y Ángela. Juntos  viven en su casa propia, ubicada en Puente Capelo (selva central peruana). Pese a las dificultades que tuvo de joven, nunca se amilanó; por el contrario se lleno de fuerzas para salir adelante con su primera hija en brazos. Es así que ya tiene 7 años dedicándose a vender una variedad de  frutas de la selva y de la costa peruana como manzanas, plátanos, naranjas, sandías, melones, duraznos, granadillas, entre otras frutas secas, con la ayuda de su hija mayor Verónica quien cada mañana abre el local acoplado en su vivienda e inicia con el negocio. Lo que más le gusta de vender las frutas es que sus hijos están en casa junto a ella y  consumen lo que vende cuidando su alimentación; “vendiendo frutas he podido construir mi casa, educar a mis hijos, mantener los gastos de mi casa y hasta vestirme, no me puedo quejar de las ganancias que me da” refiere Rosa, a la vez que resume que por eso su negocio es muy rentable para ella. Para  el futuro tiene planeado ampliar su negocio hasta el patio de su casa y surtirla de más variedad de frutas para satisfacer a sus asiduos clientes. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Selva alegre” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera una vez más, el apoyo de todos ustedes. Está agradecida por el apoyo que recibe, por eso está segura que debe pagar puntualmente si quiere seguir progresando. Rosa de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más frutas las cuales venderá al por mayor y menor, sobre todo desea comprar mandarina por la demanda que tiene este producto y así poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very hard-working woman.  She is 44 years old and lives happily together with her husband, 50 year-old Amancio.  The couple have three beautiful daughters who are their pride and joy: Verónica, Deysi and Ángela.  They live together in their own home which is located in Puente Capelo (in the central Peruvian rainforest).

In spite of the difficulties that she experienced when she was young, Rosa was never daunted.  On the contrary, she became filled with the strength to get ahead in life, carrying her eldest daughter in her arms.  For seven years, she has been selling a variety of fruits from the rainforest and the Peruvian coast such as apples, bananas, oranges, watermelons, melons, peaches, passion fruit and dried fruits.  She does this with the help of her eldest daughter Verónica who opens the premises adjoining their home and starts business.  What she most enjoys about selling her fruit is that her children are in the house with her and they eat what she sells, thereby looking after their diet.  "Through selling fruit I have been able to build my house, educate my children, cover my household expenses and even dress myself" says Rosa.  She sums up that her business is very profitable.  In the future, she plans to expand her business out onto the patio area outside her house and stock it with a greater variety of fruit so that she can satisfy her regular customers.

Rosa belongs to the "Selva Alegre" community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes, once again, to receive your support.  She is grateful for the support that she receives.  For this reason, she is certain that she will make her repayments punctually as she wants to continue making progress.  With your support, Rosa will invest the money she has requested in buying more fruit which she will sell wholesale and retail.  Above all, she would like to buy mandarins because of the demand she has for this product.  In this way, she will be able to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more varied fruit and mandarins in large quantities to meet her demand

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en:
Aleksandr, who was born in 1960 in the village of Acharkut, Tavush region, studied in the mechanics department of the Ijevan technical secondary school, after which he served in the army. He then worked at an Ijevan carpet enterprise till 1996, the year he established his own business selling men's trousers, T-shirts and belts. Aleksandr rents a stall at the Ijevan Fair and buys merchandise two to four times a month (depending on season) from Yerevan.

Aleksandr’s business allows him to support his family which consists of his wife, his daughter, his son and daughter-in-law. Aleksandr’s wife keeps house and other members of the family have their permanent work and as far as possible help their father to support the family. Aleksandr is now requesting a loan of 1.000.000 AMD to buy a summer assortment of jeans and classical models of trousers.

loans.use: to buy a summer assortment of jeans and classical models of trousers.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina was born in 1966 in Achajur village, Tavush region. Then her family moved to Ijevan city, where Alina left secondary school.
 
Now Alina lives with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. Her son is serving in the Armenian army; her daughter is a student of Yerevan State University, Ijevan branch. Alina’s parents-in-law are retirees. 

Since 1994 Alina and her husband have been engaging in clothing sales. They rent a place at Ijevan market, where they sell men’s and women’s clothes, shoes and slippers as well. Alina says that women’s clothes are in bigger demand, so the major part of her merchandise is ladies' clothes and shoes. 


Alina says that her business allows her to keep her family, support her son in the army and also to pay for her daughter's education. This is Alina’s 4th loan from Nor Horizon and now she is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy a large lot of men’s and women’s jeans to resell.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of men’s and women’s jeans to resell.

loans.name: Rouiesa

texts.en:
Rouiesa is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Rouiesa has a retail shop that sells items such as detergents, breads, biscuits, and canned goods. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and breads to stock her store.

Rouiesa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rouiesa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and breads to stock her store.

loans.name: Zulfu

texts.ru:
Zulfu jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Zulfu 55 let. 
On uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i rozvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva skota dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Zulfu is married and has two children.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person), who moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his family.  Zulfu is 55 years old.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for nine years and breeds cattle.  Currently, he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy cows and increase the quantity of livestock for future resale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is 53 years old and lives in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five lovely children, three of them have already married and live independently, the other two are single. Most rural people have been generating a business such as agriculture and raising livestock. Mrs. Sok and her husband have been running a business as domestic rice farmers. From this, they earn an income on average of $3 USD each day. 

This is the rainy season so it is so good for them to plant their rice crop. As she lacks money to start planting, Mrs. Sok would like to borrow some loan funds in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming materials. She hopes that this loan will make their family meet happiness and gain more profit. 

Note: Mrs. Sok and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.name: Sayhua Group

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa nació en el departamento del Cusco y radica hace 20 años en la ciudad de Urubamba. (La socia está levantando la mano en la fotografía). 

La señora Tomasa tiene 37 años y tiene una relación de libre unión de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia,  ella vende comida en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Urubamba y la pueden encontrar desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde en su puesto de venta todos los días. Ya son 14 años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien pero en esta oportunidad Tomasa requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas, cuyes y también para la alimentación de los animales menores.   

Las reuniones de las socias del Banco Comunal “Sayhua” son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. 

El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas de los demás socios son por ejemplo venta de animales menores, venta de comida, venta comestibles, venta de cosméticos, venta de verduras y otros brindan servicios varios. 

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. (El socio que está en la parte inferior de la fotografía llego tarde a la reunión del banco comunal).
texts.en:
Tomasa was born in Cusco department, and has been residing in the city of Urubamba for 20 years (she is the one raising her hand in the photograph). Tomasa is 37, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. She is a hard-working and responsible mother, who is helping her family get ahead in life. 

She sells meals in Urubamba's Modelo Market, and you can find her at her stall from 7:00am to 3:00pm every day. She has had the business for 14 years now, and it's going very well. But on this occasion Tomasa needs the loan to buy chickens, guinea pigs and also feed for small animals.

The members of the "Sayhua" communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Urubamba in Cusco department. The communal bank is made up of  hard-working, enterprising people who at every turn are looking for opportunities to get ahead, and through their daily effort, to provide a better future for their children. The majority of the members live in the city of Cusco, and the rest of the members have businesses where they sell for example: small animals, meals, foodstuffs, cosmetics and vegetables. Others offer various services. 

Cusco is well known for its tourism, commerce, traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because Machu Picchu, one of the Seven Wonders of the World, is located there.  

Note: The member shown in the lower part of the photograph arrived late to the meeting of the communal bank.

loans.use: To buy chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for small animals.

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is a widow and she is 65 years old with 4 children. She owns and operates a business venture, selling pancakes.  She has 1 year of experience in this business.    

She needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 210 talas or $88 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Eve joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy, a married woman, has one child. Ludy is born January 17 , 1968. Ludy is 43 years old and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Ludy operates a motorcycle transport to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, Ludy earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase spare parts for the improvement of her vehicle. Ludy has been a member of GDMPC for a year. 
In the future, Ludy plans to save her earnings for the education of her children and to purchase purchase one more motorcyle for transport.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the vehicle repair

loans.name: Maria Irela

texts.es: Maria Irela tiene 39 años, su actividad es el destace de cerdo. Hace más 8 años que tiene este medio de vida. Comenzó con este negocio porque su Mama empezó a enfermarse fue así que Maria decide hacerse cargo del negocio y ayudar en los gastos del hogar. El objetivo del préstamo es para la compra de cerdos, Maria siempre se ha destacado por brindarles a sus clientes buenos productos.
texts.en:
Maria Irela is 39 years old and she is in the business of butchering pigs. She has been involved in this activity for more than 8 years. She began this business because her mother became ill and so Maria decided to take over the business and help with the household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy pigs. Maria has always been well-thought of for providing her customers with good products.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela is 66 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with ten children. 
Tarcela has a pig business selling matured and grown pigs. She has run this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.
Tarcela has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia vive en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo y tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada y fruta D. esta relación tiene cinco hijos.

Aurelia se dedica a la venta D. frutas en uno D. los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo, ella tiene un puesto D. venta  pero que es alquilado. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Aurelia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas. Su sueño D. Aurelia es comprar un carro. 

Aurelia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Aurelia lives in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She is 57 years old, married, and she and her husband have 5 children.

Aurelia has a business selling fruit in one of the markets in the city of Ollantaytambo.  She has a sales post, but it is rented.  She has had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  At this time, Aurelia needs a loan to buy fruit.  Aurelia's dream is to buy a car.

Aurelia is grateful for the opportunity being provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is very supportive, sewing clothes to assist her husband financially. She is very fond of sewing, and she can make different styles of clothes for very reasonable prices. Bilqees is the mother of a son and a daughter. Her son sells clothes while her daughter is studying in the ninth grade. Her husband operates a grocery store in the market where he sells everyday items such as salt, sugar, and spices.

Bilqees has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her husband’s grocery business. With the loan, he will buy spices, sugar, cooking oil, snacks, and other items to fulfill the needs of his customers and increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business, and Bilqees is confident that the investment will increase his productivity, sales, and profits.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding the book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees.

loans.use: to buy products for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 42 years old, and lives in the Airport community. She is married, and she has nine children between 8 to 21 years old. All of them are currently in school and live at home, and her husband is a social worker. For the past twenty years she has been selling rubbers dishes in the market. She enjoys the profit making in the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. Her plans are to build her house and send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business

loans.name: Philimena

texts.en: Philimena is 42 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married, and her husband is a teacher. They have six children between the ages of 5 and 22 who are attending school and live at home. For the past twelve years Philimena has been selling used clothes and artificial hair (wigs) in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes and artificial hair for her business. In the future she plans to send her children to school until they finish college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes and artificial hair (wigs) for her business.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. 

Juanito has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. He has had this business for ten years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Juanito is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Juanito hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Herculano Engelberto

texts.es:
Herculano, vive con su madre, su esposa y un hijo de 22 años de edad, el trabajo de Herculano es la carpintería, este oficio lo inicio hace dos años, su hijo le ayuda a realizar los muebles, trabaja por encargo.
Por el momento Herculano solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera de cedro, laurel, aceituno, barniz, masías, pega y otros materiales necesarios para la carpintería, este préstamo será de gran ayuda para mejorar la productividad del taller.
Él tiene como objetivo crear nuevos diseños y en un futuro tener la oportunidad con más clientes demandantes de sus muebles.
texts.en:
Herculano lives with his mother, his wife, and a 22-year-old son.  Herculano's work is carpentry, a job he began two years ago.  His son helps him make the furniture.  He works on order.

For the moment Herculano is requesting a loan to buy cedar, laurel, and olive wood, and varnish, mastic, glue, and other materials necessary for carpentry.  This loan will be a great help for improving his shop's productivity.

His objective is to create new designs and in the future have the opportunity to have more customers wanting his furniture.

loans.use: to buy cedar, laurel, and olive wood, and varnish, mastic, and glue.

loans.name: Mahussi Justine

texts.fr: Mahussi Justine est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un technicien du nom de Ganiou. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Mahussi Justine vit ensemble avec son mari. Mahussi Justine assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales.  Mahussi Justine a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour subvenir à ces différents besoins, Mahussi Justine vend depuis dix huit ans des tissus. Mahussi Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. En vue de renforcer davantage son activité par l’augmentation du stock de ses produits, afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Mahussi Justine sollicite pour une troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits consentis antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus

loans.name: Mbinga Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in early 50's is married with four schooling children. She has been selling clothes (vitenge) and running a grocery store for 10 years now. She works from 7 am day to 11 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.    
This will be Salma’ 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy sets of vitenge for sale and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. 
She used the profit to repay her loan, to pay school fees and to take care of her family. She will use this loan to buy new sets of vitenge and to replace the out of stock items for the grocery. She dreams of building her own house.
Salma, will share this loan with her loan group ”MBINGA” which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new sets of vitenge and to replace the out of stock items for the grocery

loans.name: Santos Ernesto Mendo

texts.en: Iâ€™ve had my business for the past 5 years, I take photos in special events, frame photos and diplomas, sell film and cameras as well as well as car batteries.  My business has grown parallel with my improved experience and my knowledge of camera repairs. I also fix cameras but only on few occasions. I only have basic repair equipment and would need greater financing in order to improve my shop and my services.

loans.use: Buying films, batteries and glass for the studio

loans.name: Dilcia Maria

texts.en:
My name is Dilcia Maria, and my principal occupation is in producing rosquillas. I hope to start a small, home-based artisan company. I have several years of experience in this type of business. Being at home will allow me the opportunity to give proper attention to my family, and the generated revenue will contribute to familial costs and the education of my children.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Dilcia Maria, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de Rosquillas, cuento con un pequeña Micro Empresa artesanal, ubicada en mi casa de habitación, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, el que me permite atender a mi familia y generar ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de educación de mis hijos.

loans.use: To purchase corn, cheese, lard, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Mukarram

texts.en: Mukarram started her business 7 years ago. She received her first loan in April 2005. She is one of the successful clients of MicroInvest. She works at the central market of Zafarabad. Her teenage children help her in her business. Mukarram has about $2000 in her sales turnover. She buys her goods from the Istaravshan wholesale market, which is one hour away from her town. Since she started her business, the living conditions of her family have improved. She was able to buy home equipment and make repairs in their house. She often recommends receiving loans to her colleagues at the market. She and several entrepreneurs who work nearby would like to improve the condition of their storage house in the market. Each of them will invest their share of money to do this.

loans.use: Improving conditions for storage of goods

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 41, she has five children and her husband sells home made ice-cream from door to door. She crafts belts and bracelets from silk thread, and then sells them in San Cristobal de Las Casas, to merchants who have their own established stands in the market "Santo Domingo" ( an artesan market in the city). Juana is a member of the solidarity group "Betania 2." She hopes to invest the loan in the purchase of more thread to craft her products.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

JUANA TIENE 41 AÑOS, CINCO HIJOS, SU ESPOSO HACE Y VENDE HELADOS ARTESANALES DE CASA EN CASA. ELLA SE DEDICA HACER CINTURONES Y PULSERAS CON HILO DE SEDA, POSTERIORMENTE LAS VA A VENDER A SAN CRISTOBAL DE LAS CASAS CON LOS COMERCIANTES QUE TIENE SUS LOCALES ESTABLECIDOS EN EL MERCADO DE SANTO DOMINGO, ( MERCADO ARTESANAL DE LA CIUDAD ) JUANA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO SOLIDARIO BETANIA 2. CON EL PRESTAMO PIENSA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MAS HILO PARA LA ELABORAR MAS PRODUCTOS PARA VENDER

loans.use: To craft bracelets and belts.

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Mrs. Loveth E. is 34 years old, married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She derives pleasure in fixing weavon, braiding of hair and decorating brides with beads for the wedding ceremony . Mrs. Loveth hopes to improve her business with the loan amount. She is a leader of her union and has 7 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more weavon and beads for sale.

loans.name: Santa Ysabel

texts.en: Santa, 47 years old, mother of five children, is a very diligent and dynamic woman. In order to provide her children with a good education, she has been in turn a cook, house cleaner, and saleswoman. Ten years ago, she started her own business. In the morning, she sells fresh chicken parts and vegetables at the public market. At night, she makes empanadas, fried chicken, and sells drinks in her house. With the requested loan she will invest in the purchase of live chickens and some goods like flour, spices, and meat. She also wants to fix her house´s roof. This way, customers will have no problem when it rains. Given this loan, this entrepreneur will also better face her family's financial issues.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and some goods like flour, spices and other goods.  She´ll also fix the roof of her house.

loans.name: John Borbor

texts.en: John is a small trader, married with 6 children. Life was very difficult for John after the war. With some small savings, he started selling a few packets of cigarettes. When SMT expanded its activities in Makeni town of Sierra Leone, John obtained loans and diversified his business.  His children have school fees now, so he also needs to expand his business to be able to generate more income for future high school requirements. He is therefore requesting a $300 loan for the purpose. John is 52 years old.

loans.use: Expand his business in order to generate more profits for future school tuition.

loans.name: Joyce's Group

texts.en:
Joyce N. is a tailor sewing uniforms, games, and Bitengi (dresses) in Kasobi trading center. She wants to buy thread, materials, and to learn how to make good designs. She has 6 children and also looks after a grandson.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en: U. Rahima lives in Nau, Tajikistan. She is married and has 5 children. She became a client of MicroInvest because she heard many successful stories from friends about the MicroInvest loan procedure that had helped her friends to develop and improve their businesses. Thus she became a client of MicroInvest in 2005. The business stability and increase in income helped her to return her previous loan on time. Mrs. U. is engaged in selling materials. She has a good assortment (different types of material and different tinting). She is a very polite and sensitive person, which is why she has repeat customers and a good business turnover. Now Mrs. U. requests a loan of $1075 to purchase new materials.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Magamaga East D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Joy B.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to expand to bulk selling. Joy is 28 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 16 and all her children go to school. Each week, Joy makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in her business. Joy has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more charcoal and the loan was paid back on time.

Joy is joined in her small group by Jane W., Faridah T., Jane S., and Julia M.. Jane W. has a business in clothing sales and wants to add to the business. Faridah T. is currently operating a business running a grocery store and wants a loan to purchase more groceries. Jane S. operates a business selling coffee and wants to expand the business. Julia M. is currently in the business of selling spare parts and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To boost charcoal business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in material such as fabric and thread.

loans.name: Desideria

texts.es:
Desideria is married and has two children. She started her business out of necessity to obtain a higher family income given that one salary was not enough. Also, at the time, her husband’s unemployment caused her to look for additional resources and she started working on her own. Two years ago, one of her neighbors began supplying her with household cleaning products for her to sell, and she continues to carry out this activity today.

She is now requesting a loan for $US 150, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase a batch of personal cleaning products and offer demonstrations of these on her own.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Desideria es casada y tiene 2 hijos. Inició el negocio por la necesidad de obtener mas recursos para su familia dado que un solo sueldo no era suficiente, además en ese tiempo el desempleo que tenia su marido la obligo a buscar recursos y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta, hace 2 años una de sus vecinas le facilitaba productos de limpieza para su venta, actividad que continua realizando.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar un lote de productos de limpieza personal y realizar demostraciones por su cuenta.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to give her own demonstrations.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a partner of the Comunal Bank Arco Iris

Felicitas is 55 years old and married with 6 children. She travels to different fairs in the area 2 times a week to buy grains, cheese, and livestock. She then returns home and sells her products door to door. On top of that Felicitas farms her land and raises her livestock.

She needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of more livestock.

Her hope is that her kids have as many opportunities as possible, and to offer them and her business all the comforts necessary to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.

Felicitas es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Felicitas viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región 2 veces por semana, donD. compra cereales, queso, animales menores que ella beneficia, sus ventas lo realiza caminando D. casa en casa. Además Felicitas se dedica a la agricultura en sus tierras D. Rancha y también se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno y caprino.

Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. Cerdos y ganado vacuno.

Los sueños D. Felicitas son que sus hijos sean profesionales, brindar todas las comodidades a sus hijos y su negocio crezca.

loans.use: Felicitas needs a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of more livestock

loans.name: San

texts.en: San P., 44, is a widow living in the Kampong Cham province with her four children. She is supported by her children who are in the garment factories and logging industry. San P. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a small tractor. She will rent out her tractor to other farmers, and in so doing, generate a profit. She sees her area as having a need for a tractor to work the fields, and believes this opportunity will be able to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a small tractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of two machines and materials

loans.name: Saumu Salmini Group

texts.en:
Saumu is 35 years old. She is married with 6 children aged between 8 and 20 years old. She has been a juice and spices seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Saumu now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with firewood sales, charcoal sales, livestock raising, and clothes and handbag sales.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock

loans.name: Ma. Emilia

texts.es:
Ma. Emilia es originaria de García Nuevo León, su actividad principal es la venta de paletas de hielo y de snacks en un establecimiento que se encuentra ubicado en su hogar. <

> Actualmente, solicta un préstamo por USD$475 a un plazo de seis meses, con la finalidad de surtir más y mejores mercancías. <

> Ma. Emilia empezó hace dos años vendiendo paletas de hielo casa por casa y frituras en la plaza principal, gracias a los buenos resultados obtenidos ya cuenta con un puesto en su casa. La idea de iniciar con la venta de paletas de hielo y snack se debe a la necesidad de apoyar a su familia mediante la contribución de un ingreso. La familia de Ma. Emilia se compone por su esposo y cinco hijos. Ante la temporalidad del empleo de su esposo, dado que se dedica a la albañilería, Ma. Emilia se ha preocupado por apoyarlo dado que a veces el pago que recibe por su trabajo no es muy alto y a veces el mismo trabajo es escaso. <

> ¡Los invito a que apoyen a Ma. Emilia para que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo! <

>

loans.use: Sustuir mercancía para la venta de paletas de hielo y snacks.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S. was born in 1978 and she now lives in Dock Por Village in Takeo Province. Chea has four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the remaining two are too young to work or study because they are at the age of one and five years old. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Nget Chor, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes little income because his motorbike is too old and he pays a lot of money on it. In order to improve his business, his wife decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: Chea would like to buy a new motorbike to replace the old one for her husband's motor taxi service.

loans.name: Melina

texts.es: Melina tiene 19 años, es soltera, vive junto con sus padres, quienes la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos, dentro de su casa, aprovechando un pequeño negocio de servicios de cabinas de Internet que tienen sus padrinos. Esta actividad, de la venta de golosinas, la viene realizando desde hace un año atrás. Le gusta mucho porque está en contacto con todo tipo de personas, dar una buena atención es lo que hace a diario y le agrada. Le es rentable, ya que gracias al negocio que pusieron sus padrinos acude mucha gente que compran golosinas y refrescos. Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP. Esta cantidad de dinero le dará la oportunidad de comprar una vitrina más grande, para adquirir más golosinas de tipo variado para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Melina is 19 years old and is single and lives with her parents who support her very much. She works selling candy and sodas from her house thanks to a small internet cafe owned by her godparents. She has been selling candy for a year already. She likes working in this very much because she is in contact with all kind of people and she likes providing them with good attention. It is very profitable because thanks to the business set up by her godparents many people goes and buys candy and sodas. This is the first loan she is requesting to MFP. She sill use the money to buy a larger showcase and more candy of different kinds for her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a larger showcase to present her products

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente, tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales solo viven ahora con ella, 4 de ellos. Desde muy niña trabajó al cuidado del hogar y de los niños de sus vecinos, una vez que tuvo su familia se puso a vender comida en las ferias sabatinas que están cerca de su casa. Hace como 8 años puso un pequeño restaurante en su domicilio, y hace un año lo implementó con la venta de gaseosas y golosinas. La venta de comida le es muy rentable, lo dificultoso es cuando le sobra comida y no recupera parte de su capital, pero en los dias de feria, si le sale muy bien e inclusive le falta la comida. Es su 2do préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado va a incrementar sus golosinas y gaseosas para su restaurante.
texts.en:
Paulina is 49 years old, is the mother of six children, and lives with her partner and four of her children. Since she was very young she worked taking care of her home and of her neighbor's children. Once having her own family, she began to sell food at local Saturday markets. About eight years ago she opened a small restaurant in her home. One year ago she expanded her business to include the sale of soft drinks and sweets. Selling food is very lucrative and the only problem is when there is unsold food and Paulina does not recoup her investment. But on market days, she does well and even runs out of food.

This is Paulina's second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to stock up on sweets and soft drinks for her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on soft drinks and sweets for her restaurant

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su conviviente y sus 4 hijos que estudian y la apoyan mucho. Desde muy temprana edad apoyaba a sus padres con la crianza de pollos, y ahora esta actividad la realiza personalmente desde hace un año, y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es criar bien a sus pollos, y que estos estén con un peso exacto para su venta. Esta actividad le es muy rentable, ya que cada 28 días sus pollos ya están listos para la venta. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una persona responsable en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a construir un galpón más grande, y comprará más pollos bebes.
texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and lives with her partner and four children who help her out quite a bit. Since she was very young she helped her parents to raise chickens. This has now been her personal business for the past year and it is going well. She enjoys raising her chickens well so they are at the optimum weight for sale. This business has been profitable since her chickens are ready for sale every 28 days. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is responsible about making payments. With the requested funds she will have a bigger chicken hutch built and will buy more chicks.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bigger chicken hutch

loans.name: Kholmurat

texts.en:
Kholmurat A. is 43 years old. He is married with four children. Kholmurat is raising and selling cattle. He purchases calves in the central market, feeds them well, and then re-sells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 5 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up early every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them.

His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate stable and considerable income for his large family. Currently, Kholmurat is planning to expand his business and to purchase cattle. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 2500 Somoni for the term of 11 months. You could become an important part in Kholmurat family's life; he deeply appreciates the trust and support you give him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Rous

texts.en:
Rous N., 41, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has worked growing and selling rice at the market to earn an approximate US$ 4 every day. Her husband, pictured here, makes about US$ 3 by working as construction worker building houses. This couple has six children, four who are in school and two who are construction workers.

Mrs. Rous N. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This will reduce the money that her husband spends every day on public transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family transport

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. is a 42-year-old childcare provider. She has no children herself - but loves children. She herself is an orphan and she makes an effort to provide for all of the children in her care equally. She hopes one day to turn enough profit so she can purchase homes to rent to people. When we interviewed her, we talked for about 15 minutes and she is an incredibly warm and vivacious person.

loans.use: buying beds

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en: Having a mini "carenderia" (small restaurant) is really a big help for Mrs. Jovy P..  She is 35 years old, married, and lives at Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She has two children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver. Considering the economic crisis we are facing today, Mrs. P. works very hard cooking in her carenderia in order to earn the money her family needs to survive. Fortunately, the daily consumption needs of her family are met because of the carenderia. Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative is a big help to her family and business. She has availed loans several times. Now, she applies for PHP 7,000 to buy additional meats, fishes, and spices for her carenderia. She hopes that her business will be successful and expand into a full restaurant someday, where she can sell a variety of foods.

loans.use: To buy meats, fishes, and spices for carenderia

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia de 32 años es una madre muy preocupada por el bienestar de sus hijos Gabriel de 7 y Midwar de 16, vive en cuarto alquilado y tiene muchos deseos de salir adelante. Lleva más de 5 años en la venta de sobreros y gorras de segunda mano, ha encontrado en esta actividad la mejor manera de sostener económicamente a su familia, compra las gorras usadas de sus proveedores, para luego arreglarlas y el día domingo, en la ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca, las vende de manera ambulatoria. Para Celia lo más divertido de su trabajo es vender, disfruta de convencer a sus clientes de comprarle algo y así acabar con su mercadería, espera en el futuro tener una tienda de ropa donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, puesto que lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que caminar todo el día por la calles en busca de clientes. Celia sabe que el camino a sus metas es duro, pero no decae en su afán de lograr alcanzarlas. Este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad de crédito y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más participativas y responsables. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más gorras y sombreros, para incrementar la cantidad de mercadería que vende.
texts.en:
Celia, 32 years old, is a mother who is very worried about the well-being of her sons Gabriel, age 7 and Midwar, 16. She lives in a rented room and has great desire to get ahead in life. For more than 5 years she has been selling second-hand hats. She found this activity to be the best way to support her family economically. She buys the used hats from suppliers to then repair them and on Sundays, in the markets of the city of Juliaca, she sells them as an ambulatory salesperson. For Celia, the most fun part of her job is to sell as she enjoys convincing her customers to buy something and sell out of her merchandise. In the future she hopes to have a clothing store where she can sell with greater comfort and provide better service to her customers. What she likes least about her work is having to walk all day long through the streets in search of clients. Celia knows that the path to her goals is difficult, but this does not decrease her eagerness to accomplish them.
